kevin, thanks for your suggestion, I will try it as your suggestion'}, {'account_id': 8976, 'date': '2015-11-24 03:46:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35:

hi kevin, the current process for l2 agent reloading iptables was below:
1. create or delete a port, neutron-server will send a RPC message 'security_groups_member_updated' which just include security group id to l2 agent
2. l2 agent receives 'security_groups_member_updated' message and find the related devices acording security group id
3. l2 agent gets the latest security group info for related devices through RPC 'security_group_info_for_devices'
4. l2 agent reloads the iptables according the latest security group info

if I do it as your suggestion, when l2 agent receives 'security_groups_member_updated' message, we should add a new RPC method to get latest security group info according the security group ip. Compared with my previous proposal, do you think which one is better?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-26 19:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-18 09:17:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessarily iptables reload when enable ipset

when l2 agent enables ipset, if a security group just updates its members,
iptables should not be reloaded.

Implements: blueprint add-ipset-to-security

Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
'}, {'created': '2014-09-19 07:23:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary iptables reload when L2 enable ipset

this patch is to improve L2 agent when l2 agent enables ipset, if a security
group just updates its members, iptables should not be reloaded, it just need toadd members to ipset chain.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
'}, {'created': '2014-09-20 06:48:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary iptables reload when L2 enable ipset

When ipset is enabled on L2 agent, it does not need to reload iptables if
only members of security group were changed, it should just update ipset set.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c

Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
'}, {'created': '2015-01-26 06:32:15.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary iptables reload

Now in l2 agent, if a security group member changes,
the '_security_group_updated' will be called, so the
iptable rules will be reloaded, it is expensive, but
when ipset is enabled on L2 agent, it does not need
to reload iptables if only members of security group
were changed, it should just update ipset set.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
"}, {'created': '2015-02-15 02:52:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary iptables reload

Now in l2 agent, if a security group member changes,
the '_security_group_updated' will be called, so the
iptable rules will be reloaded, it is expensive, but
when ipset is enabled on L2 agent, it does not need
to reload iptables if only members of security group
were changed, it should just update ipset set.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
"}, {'created': '2015-02-25 02:55:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary iptables reload

Now in l2 agent, iptables rules being reloaded and ipset
members being updated are all done in 'update_port_filter',
it is expensive that iptables rules are reloaded, it does
not need to reload iptables rules if only members of
security group were changed, with this patch we can decouple
ipset members being updated from iptables rules being reloaded.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c
"}, {'created': '2015-03-28 02:54:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary iptables reload

not need to reload iptables rules if only members of
security group were changed, with this patch we can decouple
ipset members being updated from iptables rules being reloaded.

"}, {'created': '2015-09-17 12:01:35.000000000', 'message': "Just update ipset set if sg mermbers update

Now if user adds or removes a member from a security group,
neutron-server will notify all l2 agents with
'security_groups_member_updated', then the related l2 agents
reload their iptable rules and update their ipset sets,
actually, for this case, l2 agents just need to update their
ipsets.
This patch does the change that if a security gropu changes
its members, all related l2 agetns just update their related
ipset sets.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c

commit_message:
Just update ipset sets if sg members update

Now if a user adds or removes a member from a security group,
neutron-server will notify all l2 agents with
'security_groups_member_updated', then the related l2 agents
reload their iptable rules and update their ipset sets.
Actually, for this case, l2 agents just need to update their
ipset sets.
This patch does the change that if a security group changes
its members, all related l2 agents just update their related
ipset sets.

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: I0bd6d62283e921026b387ecb8acb5d925b32948c

subject: Enable mutable config in Neutron-lbaas
messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-06 20:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-04-09 20:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:01:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have a few reservations about this patch:
1. neutron-lbaas is deprecated and under feature freeze. This appears to be a feature addition and not a bug fix.
2. neutron-lbaas aside from the agent and sub-process gets it's configuration from neutron since it runs in the neutron context. The value of enabling this is fairly low and limited to two sub-processes.
So my initial vote is -1, but if someone can make a compelling case of why these are needed/fit policy, I am open to discussion."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-19 08:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 20:10:19.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in Neutron-lbaas

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Neutron-lbaas delegates
making this call to oslo.service.
This was provided in patchset
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e

Further patches will be needed to make select config options be
marked as mutable. This change enables support for oslo provided
config options to be updated via SIGHUP such as log level.

Change-Id: Icb405ae7197af7507469593e8555b833186c0e68
Task: 12515
Story: 2001545
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Neutron-lbaas

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Neutron-lbaas delegates
making this call to oslo.service.
This was provided in patchset
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e

Further patches will be needed to make select config options be
marked as mutable. This change enables support for oslo provided
config options to be updated via SIGHUP such as log level.

Change-Id: Icb405ae7197af7507469593e8555b833186c0e68
Task: 12515
Story: 2001545

commit_message:
Correct indentation and file path

Indentation for few lines is corrected and
correct path for config file is updated. data
folder is deleted during update/upgrade. Set
correct permissions (42462:42462) for
genius-mdsalutil-config.xml. 42462 comes from
kolla and is id for odl user inside the container.

Closes-Bug: 1764603
Change-Id: Ie343cd4cab7cc009b1940a98fa73b1ac15b3b56d

commit_message:
Migrate Ceph deployment to external_deploy_task

Uses external_deploy_tasks instead of workflow_tasks for the
deployment of Ceph, via ceph-ansible.

Initially, external_deploy_tasks are added alongside workflow_tasks so
that CI will pass. Once CI is updated to use config-download for these
jobs, we will remove the workflow_tasks.

Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint ceph-ansible-external-deploy-tasks
Change-Id: I4b88e97c38ff394023a92bec5631b3cd0f6e293e

Adds an optional environment that can be used to disable workflow_tasks
by mapping OS::Mistral resources to None. This environment can be used
by CI so that the updated ceph jobs
(I757be222143e41392b474d6b20c7a7b7df4537de) can be converted to
external_deploy_tasks, but the existing workflow_tasks can be
temporarily disabled until they are removed from the templates.

Change-Id: Ib39313712ea03e5562e7b19875c178e9c8dfef54
'}]
commit_message:
Environment to disable workflow_tasks

Adds an optional environment that can be used to disable workflow_tasks
by mapping OS::Mistral resources to None. This environment can be used
by CI so that the updated ceph jobs
(I757be222143e41392b474d6b20c7a7b7df4537de) can be converted to
external_deploy_tasks, but the existing workflow_tasks can be
temporarily disabled until they are removed from the templates.

Change-Id: Ib39313712ea03e5562e7b19875c178e9c8dfef54

commit_message:
Move common SG workflow classes into separate module

This is a preparation for a fix of bug 1750147
to avoid some import circulation.

Change-Id: I4198c3b137976413ebb704d58162b56dbb321a9b
Related-Bug: #1750147

commit_message:
Exclude epel element for diskimage-builder

In I2ffdd9f615ae6b00428c17249e4f216774991b99 we reworked the logic in
pip-and-virtualenv element to add epel as a dependency. We need to now
exclude epel since is it a dependency.

Change-Id: I43562f960cc100d4ec19b8a5e72c5929e24619ba
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 03:26:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove installed packages before pip install

The release of pip10 has shown up a few issues here

Firstly, pip10 now refuses to overwrite distutils installed packages,
which includes "python-virtualenv" on centos.  History has shown us
that we want the packages installed and overwritten, to avoid the
packages coming back and messing things up.

Pre-install all the packages, then list the files in the packages with
"rpm" directly and remove them.  This way pip is happy to install.

We need to take better account of the package names for this; on
Fedora things have switch to "python2-virtualenv" instead of
"python-virtualenv" and we can't use an alias to list the package
contents.

This also highlighted that python2-pip is in EPEL for centos, so
enable that when we install it.

There is a related change in recent fedora that python3 now installs
binaries into /usr/local/bin.  There are commented swizzles in here to
ensure we retain the status quo of "pip" and "virtualenv" both being
python2 based, with the python3 versions being called explicitly
"pip3" and "virtualenv3" respectively.

Change-Id: I2ffdd9f615ae6b00428c17249e4f216774991b99
'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 04:24:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove installed packages before pip install

commit_message:
Remove installed packages before pip install

The release of pip10 has shown up a few issues here

Firstly, pip10 now refuses to overwrite distutils installed packages,
which includes "python-virtualenv" on centos.  History has shown us
that we want the packages installed and overwritten, to avoid the
packages coming back and messing things up.

Pre-install all the packages, then list the files in the packages with
"rpm" directly and remove them.  This way pip is happy to install.

We need to take better account of the package names for this; on
Fedora things have switch to "python2-virtualenv" instead of
"python-virtualenv" and we can't use an alias to list the package
contents.

This also highlighted that python2-pip is in EPEL for centos, so
enable that when we install it.  Make the epel element a no-op for non
centos/rhe distros.

There is a related change in recent fedora that python3 now installs
binaries into /usr/local/bin.  There are commented swizzles in here to
ensure we retain the status quo of "pip" and "virtualenv" both being
python2 based, with the python3 versions being called explicitly
"pip3" and "virtualenv3" respectively.

Change-Id: I2ffdd9f615ae6b00428c17249e4f216774991b99

[{'created': '2018-04-18 16:42:31.000000000', 'message': "Call _sync_other_items from _choose_replication_mode

- move _sync_other_items from db_replicator superclass to the
container replicator subclass, which reduces container specific
changes in the superclass.

- call _sync_other_items before choosing any other sync method, so
that shard ranges are always replicated before objects - this avoids a
potential race when misplaced objects are moved to an acceptor before
the acceptor knows that its shard range has expanded. Before, there
was a risk that another racing process on the acceptor might have
moved the recently merged replicated objects back to where the were
just moved from.

- this change unfortunately means that shard ranges will be
unnecessarily usync'd prior to an rsync_then_merge, but
rsync_then_merge is unlikely for a container with enough objects that
it is sharding or sharded.

Change-Id: I5b32abcd82ac45cf8e928454b6f3d3de22b09886
"}, {'created': '2018-04-18 16:48:01.000000000', 'message': "Call _sync_other_items from _choose_replication_mode

container replicator subclass, which reduces container specific
changes in the superclass.

- call _sync_other_items before choosing any other sync method, so
that shard ranges are always replicated before objects - this avoids a
potential race when misplaced objects are moved to an acceptor before
the acceptor knows that its shard range has expanded. Before, there
was a risk that another racing process on the acceptor might have
moved the recently merged replicated objects back to where the were
just moved from.

- this change unfortunately means that shard ranges will be
unnecessarily usync'd prior to an rsync_then_merge, but
rsync_then_merge is unlikely for a container with enough objects that
it is sharding or sharded.

Change-Id: I5b32abcd82ac45cf8e928454b6f3d3de22b09886
"}]
commit_message:
Call _sync_other_items from _choose_replication_mode

- move _sync_other_items from db_replicator superclass to the
container replicator subclass, which reduces container specific
changes in the superclass.

- call _sync_other_items before choosing any other sync method, so
that shard ranges are always replicated before objects - this avoids a
potential race when misplaced objects are moved to an acceptor before
the acceptor knows that its shard range has expanded. Before, there
was a risk that another racing process on the acceptor might have
moved the recently merged replicated objects back to where the were
just moved from.

- this change unfortunately means that shard ranges will be
unnecessarily usync'd prior to an rsync_then_merge, but
rsync_then_merge is unlikely for a container with enough objects that
it is sharding or sharded.

Change-Id: I5b32abcd82ac45cf8e928454b6f3d3de22b09886

commit_message:
[lang] Fixes PUBLISH_DIR for api-quick-start

Since api-quick-start publish location (api-guide/quick-start) is
different from standard scheme, we need to explicit PUBLISH_DIR
for translated api-quick-start documents.

Change-Id: I36d54d618a7ae0f32f5b8d86488b540f1be997c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I3b233a79689858db0962bafe71eba0a0667c2bf0
Closes-Bug: #1762431
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I3b233a79689858db0962bafe71eba0a0667c2bf0
Closes-Bug: #1762431

commit_message:
Function versioning API: delete

When deleting a function version:

- The version should not being used by any job
- The version should not being used by any webhook
- Function latest_version should be updated if the version in request equals
  to latest_version

Story: #2001829
Task: #14349
Change-Id: I5511304e04bec8f404d7224a6489b65d6a765316

commit_message:
Avoid showing password in log

per bug indicated, the password is shown in the log.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L295
indicated auth_password can be masked through mask_password method.

Change-Id: I725eea1866642b40cc6b065ed0e8aefb91ca2889
Closes-Bug: 1761054

commit_message:
Improve idempotency of block device processing

Record details of each device that is successfully processed as
an OSD data device to ensure that they are not re-processed
during subsequent hook executions.

"successfully processed" in this case means that the call to
either ceph-disk or ceph-volume to prepare (and potentially
activate) the OSD completed without error.

This avoids potential data loss on reboot when osd-reformat is
set to True as the charm will only every process a block device
once.

Change-Id: I2c6e9d5670c8d1d70584ae19b34eaf16be5dea19

commit_message:
Fix binascii hexlify under Python 3

Add wrapper functions for binascii hexlify/unhexlify to deal with the
conversion between bytes and str.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: I8351b30b62ba19290e05c30499c3588649f8f367
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a5cc40f488610694da92f6d8f86f83460dd2567c)

messages:
[{'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-02-07 11:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-07 11:18:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-19 05:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Add Manage Security Groups action for container
messages:
[{'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-07 19:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-07 19:45:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Shu,

After applying this patch, it looks I cannot 'stop and delete container' anymore. It gave me this error: https://ibb.co/kgqKBc . Are you able to reproduce this error?"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-07 20:32:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Shu,

Sorry, another comment on this patch. Just want to let you know that Zun might follow Nova to deprecate all the proxy APIs to Neutron. The proxy APIs includes the two APIs to add/remove security group to/from container: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/deprecate-security-group-api . However, this BP is not finalized yet and we need to discuss it further.

For this patch, in long term, I wonder if it is feasible to avoid using the proxy APIs and re-implement the equivalent functionality by using neutron API directly. In particular, we can consider the following implementation:

* For adding security group to a container, we can (i) do a Zun API call to retrieve the list of neutron ports of the container, and (ii) for each container's port, do a neutron API call to add the security group to the port.
* For removing security group from a container, it is similar.

However, this is a long term shoot. I am fine to merge the current implementation if you want."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-07 21:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @Shu,
 > 
 > After applying this patch, it looks I cannot 'stop and delete
 > container' anymore. It gave me this error: https://ibb.co/kgqKBc .
 > Are you able to reproduce this error?

Sorry. The issue is irrelevant to this patch. I proposed a fix in a separated patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559502/"}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-09 03:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thanks for reviewing and noticing me about deprecation on proxy API. I will try to use neutron API directly for adding/deleting security group on this patch.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

I'm considering to remove "Security Groups" tab from container creation dialog and unify managing the associations between port and security group into another action "Manage Security Groups".'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

this does not work yet.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > I'm considering to remove "Security Groups" tab from container
 > creation dialog and unify managing the associations between port
 > and security group into another action "Manage Security Groups".

Shu,

I think users would appreciate the "Security Groups" tab for container creation because this workflow is what they used to do on creating a VM. However, it is possibly a good idea to remove the "Security Groups" tab for container update and unify the security groups management as you mentioned.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-10 00:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The reason for unifying into new action is ... 
I'm confused about which port is associated with security group when user sets multiple networks or ports. Anyway, in this patch, I will not remove "Security Groups" tab on creation dialog. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> The reason for unifying into new action is ...
 > I'm confused about which port is associated with security group
 > when user sets multiple networks or ports. Anyway, in this patch, I
 > will not remove "Security Groups" tab on creation dialog. Thanks.

Zun is following nova's implementation for handling security groups. That is, if users create a container with multiple pre-existing ports and multiple network, the security groups are not applied for pre-existing ports but applied for ports created from networks.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Zun is following nova's implementation for handling security groups. That is, if users create a container with multiple pre-existing ports and multiple network, the security groups are not applied for pre-existing ports but applied for ports created from networks.
@Hongbin, thanks for the explanation. It's good to describe the explanation into help on creation dialog. I will add description in another patch."}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-10 09:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-10 09:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

This patch adds "Manage Security Groups" action, and does not remove "Security Groups" tab for now.
Patchset 3 shows new dialog, but does not submit changes yet.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This patch adds "Manage Security Groups" action, and does not
 > remove "Security Groups" tab for now.
 > Patchset 3 shows new dialog, but does not submit changes yet.

Cool! I like the dialog very much.

FYI, there is another patch in server side for fixing the population of 'default' security group: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542004/ . If that patch is merged, this dialog might need to update.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-11 05:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-11 07:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-12 03:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

this works fine but needs release notes for this. Also, add blueprint.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-12 05:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-13 04:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Wow! This is a great work. It looks very nice and robust. Thanks for your hard work.

I have two comments inline. One is an irrelevant issue. The other one is a minor issue. In overall, this patch are ready to go.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Cool. It is perfect now!'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-04-19 05:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add Manage Security Groups action for container

This patch adds "Manage Security Groups" action as item action
for the container. This action manages the associations
between port and security group.

Change-Id: Ic39a985c7daffdb7f5e5616a0eb3c07d57c4db22
Implements: blueprint manage-security-groups

commit_message:
Update stack and add heartbeat

Heartbeat has been enabled which will allow us to check the uptime of
hosts and services.

Stack updates have been made to correct a couple templating issues and
reduce template sizes by using includes where we have common config.

Change-Id: I47e32ac4b4ce8ca3ea572d8384660011af7cde6a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 18:46:49.000000000', 'message': 'Allow exit code of 2 only for puppet deployments

Only the puppet hook script should be allowed to exit with a return code
of 2 and not be considered failed. All other Heat agent hooks are
considered failed with any non-zero return code.

Change-Id: I7c6c5e6395dbcf049072ecb1228fc10f83f1db7f
'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 12:00:01.000000000', 'message': 'Allow exit code of 0 only for deployments

All the hook scripts record 0 for success and non-zero for failure.

hook-puppet.py already handles a successful return code of 0 or 2 for
puppet and always writes a 0 as the return code to indicate success to
the json status file[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates/blob/master/hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py#L161

Change-Id: I7c6c5e6395dbcf049072ecb1228fc10f83f1db7f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow exit code of 0 only for deployments

All the hook scripts record 0 for success and non-zero for failure.

hook-puppet.py already handles a successful return code of 0 or 2 for
puppet and always writes a 0 as the return code to indicate success to
the json status file[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates/blob/master/hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py#L161

Change-Id: I7c6c5e6395dbcf049072ecb1228fc10f83f1db7f

commit_message:
Retry previously failed deployments

Previously, when the server pre and post deployments were run, if one
failed, it would not be automatically retried since the deployed file
for the deployment exists under /var/lib/heat-config/deployed.

This could be overridden by passing -e force=true to ansible-playbook,
however for deployments that have previously failed, I don't think this
should be required, and we should just retry them automatically.

This new behavior more closely matches the traditional behavior with
Heat, where a stack update would automatically attempt to reapply and
deployment that was in a failed state.

Change-Id: I18df88297abe7be50364233ed8f2514de6d3d434
Closes-Bug: #1756921

commit_message:
Function versioning API: get

Support 2 types of queries:

- Get basic function version information
- Download package of that specific function version

The previous function downloading process is not affected.

TODO:

- Test of downloading function version package will be added in
  functional test(in the subsequent patch)

Change-Id: I1bcb7c13a7b65432e1d6714d7539077ab82ee831
Story: #2001829
Task: #14335

commit_message:
Remove deprecated nova api calls from EIP/EIPAssociation

This removes the add_floatingip/remove_floatingip nova
calls from these resources.

Change-Id: Ic2672982d7f1e0644268e35a9d79a33ec2f922cd

commit_message:
Fix verify document service list output error

Service list not support display 'Created At' in this patch.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544161/

Service list was support display 'Availability Zone' in this
patch.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543261/

Change-Id: Ia9fc46c4086549f102c8ca4d938285a00765ad6a
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Iaf6b91824940cdc2fd4faf1dffc8e3059435907d

commit_message:
NEC driver: Add parameter to make max volumes per pool changeable.

Currently, the max number of volumes (logical disks) per pool is
hard-coded. This patch makes the value changeable.

Change-Id: I0781e730d29bbb83d70a7557d3c1f25b54edc3bb

commit_message:
Unity: fail to detach lun when auto zone enabled

When the lun is the last one attached to the host and it is detached,
the attribute `host.host_luns` is None. Use `not` in if statement which
is pythonic in checking None and empty list of `host.host_luns`.

Change-Id: I5d8f63f9a78d001bc699af538f586aab8d73a5cf
Closes-bug: #1759175
(cherry picked from commit c816be897e7ab1c95b38979b2cc94ecf179e44e7)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated nova calls for floatingip

This replaces the deprecated nova api calls for
add_floatingip/remove_floatingip. Nova api microversion > 2.43
does not support it.

Change-Id: I3e6c9f56b84934a937a2275acd58fd9891a00e75

commit_message:
Drop py33 target in tox.ini

We support py35 now.so it is no need to keep
the supoort for py33.

Change-Id: I2286bf2c2c324e2da5c5302cbebfe93b139520c3

subject: Stop replicating object rows when container could be sharded
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-05 05:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-05 05:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Very much a work in progress, I almost certainly broke a whole bunch of tests.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)

This is going to work! But maybe having the sender make the decision (a) avoids the args problem and (b) allows for more intelligent decision.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-05 17:21:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-06 00:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-06 23:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-08 05:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-08 05:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-03-08 06:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-08 10:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(6 comments)

Definitely heading the right way IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-08 12:20:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've added some notes about what we need to achieve at the top of this etherpad [1] based on my recollection of the Dublin discussions. We can discuss further there.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/deep-containers-replication"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-08 19:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-09 18:38:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

:( I think this may sometimes break cleaving and misplaced objects movement. When we cleave, we create an old-fashioned hash.db and then replicate it to the remote, which may have shard ranges, or a newer epoch.

Current tests probably won't complain because this lets per_diff rows escape, but IRL this may abort cleaving replication.

I'm looking into making cleave-replication use the current epoch of the destination when creating its 'handoff' db."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-13 19:29:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

re my previous comment, this should help https://review.openstack.org/552668 - cleave db's should now have epoch of shard container"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-03-14 22:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Mostly just ramping up and reading current set of comments & concerns.  Seems like we have some work to do here.  I'm going to try and find a few other things to merge before I dive back in tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-15 05:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-15 05:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hopefully I'll be able to clean this up more tomorrow, but I'm getting tired and want to get what I've got off my laptop.

You'll probably need to crank down the per_diff setting, and the handoff is still refusing to rsync_then_merge when there are no object rows... so that condition needs to be a little more precise. I generally like where it's going, though -- particularly as it relies much more on the state of the local broker rather than what we get in replicate responses. On the plus side, I've dropped a patch from the chain.

Oh, and I've gone and made the situation in the probe test *so much worse*. It's gonna be great."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Still need to fix up more unit tests. Do we have a good way of knowing that this is a sub-broker when we're in the midst of replicating the old db? Not sure I like how I'm doubling up fetching and merging shard ranges when we've already got a newer db... but I'm not seeing how I can avoid it yet.

I think probe tests should pass now?"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:31:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Just posting this comment before I forget but haven't completely reviewed. I think I see where you're going though."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Couple old comments in case Clay can spare some cycles to rebase/fixup'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-16 23:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-16 23:34:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

After getting things rebased and merged what looked correctly I'm finding there's some (new?) tests still failing.  I'm trying to get those working and understand more of what's going on.  Still not done.  I'll pick up again tomorrow - or review where we're at."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Pushing this up but still need to fix unit tests and one probe test.

Fixed 2/3 of test_replication_to_shard* tests to verify the zero-object replication behaviour.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-17 18:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-17 21:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-17 22:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

still cleanup to do'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

(6 comments)

@Clay I reverted your change to the sense of expect_success in the replicator unit tests. Seems like now we have cleanup_post_replicate there is no need to pretend the replication to nodes failed. Feel free to discuss/push back.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-18 18:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-18 20:07:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

looks good and makes sense so far'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-19 00:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(8 comments)

Since I love all the stuff in the NEXT patch too I want to merge this and do fixes as follow up.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 05:26:48.000000000', 'message': "Stop replicating rows from large DBs to sharded containers

Now, if a container-server sees that it's sharded while the replica that
sent the sync request isn't, it'll reply 409 Conflict. The response will
have a json body similar to the normal sync response, with the addition
of the current shard ranges.

On the container-replicator side, eat that response: pick up all the
sharding metadata (notably epoch), merge in all of the shard ranges, and
move on. When the container-sharder comes around, it will proceed to
cleave the retired DB, leaving just the sharded epoch DB. If a handoff,
this will be cleaned up on the next round of replication.

Change-Id: I289f558381d028b4d3129e4e51549d3f1a58dc2f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-06 00:29:11.000000000', 'message': "Stop replicating rows from large DBs to sharded containers

Now, if a container-server sees that it's sharded while the replica that
sent the sync request isn't, it'll reply 409 Conflict. The response will
have a json body similar to the normal sync response, with the addition
of the current shard ranges.

On the container-replicator side, eat that response: pick up all the

move on. When the container-sharder comes around, it will proceed to
cleave the retired DB, leaving just the sharded epoch DB. If a handoff,
this will be cleaned up on the next round of replication.

Change-Id: I289f558381d028b4d3129e4e51549d3f1a58dc2f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-06 23:37:31.000000000', 'message': "Stop replicating rows from large DBs to sharded containers

Now, container-servers include shard ranges in the initial sync
response. On the other end, if a container-replicator gets back
shard ranges from a primary it otherwise would've wanted to
rsync_then_merge with, it'll eat those rows, still send its own shard
ranges, but refuse to do anything with object rows -- we should instead
wait for the container-sharder to come around and cleave them where they
belong, leaving just the sharded epoch db. If a handoff, this will be
cleaned up on the next round of replication.

Change-Id: I289f558381d028b4d3129e4e51549d3f1a58dc2f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-08 05:07:17.000000000', 'message': "Stop replicating object rows from large DBs to sharded containers

Add a new 'get_shard_ranges' RPC and have the container-replicator use
it to do a two-way sync of shard ranges when

   - the remote DB has shard ranges,
   - the local DB is unsharded or sharding, and
   - there's more than one diff's worth of object rows that would need
     to be shipped (i.e., it previously would have done an
     rsync_then_merge)

Under these circumstances, the replicator will log a warning then skip
syncing the object rows, instead waiting for the container-sharder to
cleave rows to their (hopefully final) destination, leaving just the
sharded epoch DB. If a handoff, this will be cleaned up on the next
round of replication.

Change-Id: I289f558381d028b4d3129e4e51549d3f1a58dc2f

commit_message:
Stop replicating object rows when container could be sharded

Add a new 'get_shard_ranges' RPC and have the container-replicator use
it to do a two-way sync of shard ranges on all successful syncs.
Expect (and ignore) 500s during upgrades.

Then, be willing to abort replication if we have shard ranges
locally. Instead, wait for the container-sharder to cleave rows to
their (hopefully final) destination, leaving just the sharded epoch DB.
If a handoff, this will be cleaned up on the next round of replication.

Change-Id: I289f558381d028b4d3129e4e51549d3f1a58dc2f

[{'created': '2018-04-17 23:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'Kibana: Update authentication values in endpoints and deployment

The Kibana username and password needs to match the same settings
for Elasticsearch, as these credentials are used to manage the
.kibana index created on startup and to perform the queries on the
backing Elasticsearch index. This moves to use the same set of
creds for Kibana and Elasticsearch in the Kibana chart

Change-Id: Ife3fd916e8d9a3f8877d01a9048a892f92e412d8
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 14:53:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update kibana authentication values in endpoints and deployment

The Kibana username and password needs to be included in the
Elasticsearch endpoints, as to allow the Elasticsearch apache
proxy to include the kibana credentials in its htpasswd file.
Elasticsearch needs to include the kibana credentials to allow
proxying kibana requests to the Elasticsearch backend to enable
queries to be routed appropriately

Change-Id: Ife3fd916e8d9a3f8877d01a9048a892f92e412d8
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 15:13:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update kibana authentication values in endpoints and deployment

The Kibana username and password needs to be included in the
Elasticsearch endpoints, as to allow the Elasticsearch apache
proxy to include the kibana credentials in its htpasswd file.
Elasticsearch needs to include the kibana credentials to allow
proxying kibana requests to the Elasticsearch backend to enable
queries to be routed appropriately

Change-Id: Ife3fd916e8d9a3f8877d01a9048a892f92e412d8
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 16:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update kibana authentication values in endpoints and deployment

The Kibana username and password needs to match the Elasticsearch
username and password, as Kibana requires an authorized elasticsearch
user to make queries against the elasticsearch backend to display
its dashboards and set up the initial .kibana index. This changes
the apache proxy running in front of kibana to consume the
elasticsearch username and password via the elasticsearch secret in
the chart to ensure kibana has proper access

commit_message:
Update kibana authentication values in endpoints and deployment

The Kibana username and password needs to match the Elasticsearch
username and password, as Kibana requires an authorized elasticsearch
user to make queries against the elasticsearch backend to display
its dashboards and set up the initial .kibana index. This changes
the apache proxy running in front of kibana to consume the
elasticsearch username and password via the elasticsearch secret in
the chart to ensure kibana has proper access

Change-Id: Ife3fd916e8d9a3f8877d01a9048a892f92e412d8

[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:48:50.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify sizing when creating vol from source

The api-ref stated new volumes created from a source volume or

Change-Id: Id2e0d53b56d5879026c182521a512dc2cfcd28f7

commit_message:
Clarify sizing when creating vol from source

The api-ref stated new volumes created from a source volume or
snapshot would have the same size as the original, but that is
not the case if a larger size is requested.

Change-Id: Id2e0d53b56d5879026c182521a512dc2cfcd28f7

commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12
(cherry picked from commit 74f70b7a33fe7589cdb28ab44235f83aa5cda158)

commit_message:
Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Change-Id: Iec6be0b99e84b0c89f791c3c9694fe10f3a1e7db
(cherry picked from commit 785d1b2b38805e35bf344792342b255aedfa3549)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Related-Bug: #1765065
Change-Id: I4f73c304de9474946c604726aba6e84cb7863431
(cherry picked from commit cc9376a9c9ab78fbfa92a3708ba464618b57f521)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 11:54:00.000000000', 'message': 'Run backup compression on native thread

Backup data compression is a CPU bound operation that will not yield to
other greenthreads, so given enough simultaneous backup operations they
will lead to other threads' starvation.

This is really problematic for DB connections, since starvation will
lead to connections getting dropped with errors such as "Lost connection
to MySQL server during query".

Detailed information on why these connections get dropped can be found
in comment "[31 Aug 2007 9:21] Magnus Blåudd" on this MySQL bug [1].

These DB issues may result in backups unnecessary ending in an "error"
state.

This patch fixes this by moving the compression to a native thread so
the cooperative multitasking in Cinder Backup can continue switching
threads.

[1] https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=28359

Closes-Bug: #1692775
Closes-Bug: #1719580
Change-Id: I1946dc0ad9cb7a68072a39816fa9fa224c2eb6a5

(cherry picked from commit 41754fd57f27bba646d1d6e26388c7f5f4c2dc4e)
'}, {'created': '2018-04-14 19:12:15.000000000', 'message': 'Run backup compression on native thread

These DB issues may result in backups unnecessary ending in an "error"

This patch fixes this by moving the compression to a native thread so
the cooperative multitasking in Cinder Backup can continue switching
threads.

[1] https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=28359

Closes-Bug: #1692775
Closes-Bug: #1719580
Change-Id: I1946dc0ad9cb7a68072a39816fa9fa224c2eb6a5

commit_message:
Run backup compression on native thread

Backup data compression is a CPU bound operation that will not yield to
other greenthreads, so given enough simultaneous backup operations they
will lead to other threads' starvation.

This is really problematic for DB connections, since starvation will
lead to connections getting dropped with errors such as "Lost connection
to MySQL server during query".

Detailed information on why these connections get dropped can be found
in comment "[31 Aug 2007 9:21] Magnus Blåudd" on this MySQL bug [1].

These DB issues may result in backups unnecessary ending in an "error"
state.

This patch fixes this by moving the compression to a native thread so
the cooperative multitasking in Cinder Backup can continue switching
threads.

[1] https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=28359

Closes-Bug: #1692775
Closes-Bug: #1719580
Change-Id: I1946dc0ad9cb7a68072a39816fa9fa224c2eb6a5
(cherry picked from commit af0f00bc52f79d9395adfe0575b0dbe353e18bbe)
(cherry picked from commit 439f90da8e4c1cfa1acfe36b5ea8a6c5bae6139f)
(cherry picked from commit b241f93267646a6501e3a5fb14521f05e38a2ae9)
(cherry picked from commit 41754fd57f27bba646d1d6e26388c7f5f4c2dc4e)

commit_message:
Change sysmeta name from swift3 to s3api

And add a magic to translate existing swift3 sysmeta to s3api sysmeta
at swift.common.middleware.s3api.response.Response to upgrade easy from swift3
to s3api.

Change-Id: I4c11274a69863be04fd2b1ca4c1d4d9aadbff2de

... in favor of just specifying an auth_uri (which *must* include a
version).

Note that this breaks from swift3, which needed to work with old configs
where version wasn't baked into the auth_uri.

Change-Id: Ie6af5764165adf69250373cd5f131bb140de13bc
"}]
commit_message:
Remove auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol, and auth_version options

... in favor of just specifying an auth_uri (which *must* include a
version).

Note that this breaks from swift3, which needed to work with old configs
where version wasn't baked into the auth_uri.

Change-Id: Ie6af5764165adf69250373cd5f131bb140de13bc

This should NOT be an impact on upgrading because the request environ
key is prepared for each request. It's nice that s3api is in swift upstream

Change-Id: I87e964e2dd0c72d07f4f43b357bc7b0ee6cf4360
"}]
commit_message:
Rename auth_details key from swift3 to s3api

This should NOT be an impact on upgrading because the request environ
key is prepared for each request. It's nice that s3api is in swift upstream
repo because we can resolve this issue with only ONE commit at once.

Change-Id: I87e964e2dd0c72d07f4f43b357bc7b0ee6cf4360

subject: Cleanup swift/common/middleware/s3api/test dir
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 23:15:57.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup swift/common/middleware/s3api/test dir

The scripts in the dir was used to setup functional tests
but they will be never used in swift upstream so let's cleanup
those scripts.

The configs for ceph-s3-test would be useful to make non-voting
gate in the swift upstream, this patch moves them into doc/s3api/conf
dir that is not included source code tree, anyway.

Change-Id: I608ed3a620478bc4ab2fdd8901ea987e356298c9
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup swift/common/middleware/s3api/test dir

The scripts in the dir was used to setup functional tests
but they will be never used in swift upstream so let's cleanup
those scripts.

The configs for ceph-s3-test would be useful to make non-voting
gate in the swift upstream, this patch moves them into doc/s3api/conf
dir that is not included source code tree, anyway.

Change-Id: I608ed3a620478bc4ab2fdd8901ea987e356298c9

subject: Remove conf from s3 request
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 23:15:57.000000000', 'message': "Remove conf from s3 request

The parent patch did just mechanical translation from global
CONF instance to local self.conf in the controller.

This patch tries to pull the conf from Request instance that
is actually needn't, just set some variable should be fine to us.

Change-Id: I006145f1d4d70bf3e0ba6a1d4698e75c08cd004b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove conf from s3 request

The parent patch did just mechanical translation from global
CONF instance to local self.conf in the controller.

This patch tries to pull the conf from Request instance that
is actually needn't, just set some variable should be fine to us.

Change-Id: I006145f1d4d70bf3e0ba6a1d4698e75c08cd004b

test tree: test/functional.

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Merge s3api func tests

Merge s3api tests back into swift's functional
test tree: test/functional.

Also:
- Skip if s3api is not enabled in the pipeline
- Fix some broken things at multipart upload since logging change
- Add in process func-s3api env to tox

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Idcb6a92bc203de1fe6868f73c72205258e2249a8

subject: Avoid global LOGGER instance
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 23:15:57.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid global LOGGER instance

We should not use global variable as possible. This patch removes
the LOGGER global variable. And then, add get_logger to some places
that need to log.

Change-Id: I6041cfa10a2e2461b87d3fae9bc453858f03ace2
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid global LOGGER instance

We should not use global variable as possible. This patch removes
the LOGGER global variable. And then, add get_logger to some places
that need to log.

Change-Id: I6041cfa10a2e2461b87d3fae9bc453858f03ace2

subject: Import all swift3 code as s3api
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 23:15:57.000000000', 'message': 'Import all swift3 code as s3api

Briefly saying, the steps we will do:

1. Rename swift3 namespace to swift.common.middleware.s3api
1.1 Rename also some conflicted class names (e.g. Request/Response)

2. Move unittests to test/unit/ dir to be able to run on the gate.

3. Move functests to test/functional/ and setup in-process testing

4. Move docs to doc dir

5. use get_logger()

Ex. fix various minor issue on those steps (e.g. packages, dependencies)

Change-Id: Iebc7509e04166e38415341af40071fed8935b770
'}]
commit_message:
Import all swift3 code as s3api

Briefly saying, the steps we will do:

1. Rename swift3 namespace to swift.common.middleware.s3api
1.1 Rename also some conflicted class names (e.g. Request/Response)

2. Move unittests to test/unit/ dir to be able to run on the gate.

3. Move functests to test/functional/ and setup in-process testing

4. Move docs to doc dir

5. use get_logger()

Ex. fix various minor issue on those steps (e.g. packages, dependencies)

Change-Id: Iebc7509e04166e38415341af40071fed8935b770

also update the commit summary to use BIOS Settings: prefix.

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: Add bios_interface db field

Add bios_interface DB field, database migration,
and object entry for node bios functionality.

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I48c96d5da0cb747b3ca3fceea9b4ffa85a9ebe22
Change-Id: I3a4f92fa880deef6e7882819afbadde2aff06161
Partial-Bug: #1712032

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 3

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-shelve-start
* instance-shelve-end
* instance-shelve_offload-start
* instance-shelve_offload-end
* instance-unshelve-start
* instance-unshelve-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: Ic64f89d33a985cf6121ddc198380902a5e936ec4

But I'm going to hold off because I just got a ping that we might need something else in here."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I verified the hashes.  If my understanding is correct, this will cause the tag for 6.0.1 to be created (it doesn't exist at this time).  If so, this LGTM.  (Assuming someone else will validate all the YAMLisms.)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:55:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Tag nova-powervm 6.0.1

Requests a tag for nova-powervm 6.0.1.

This is the first tag request for nova-powervm in openstack/releases
so the yaml file did not previously exist. This adds some of the
previous branches and tags to that file as well for the sake of
tooling.

This is done in the _independent directory because nova-powervm
was not yet under governance in the Queens timeframe.

Change-Id: I90aa1a08301885fd262b501bb4f8e54632b97445

commit_message:
Parse forbidden in extra_specs

Accept forbidden traits in the processing of extra_specs, with the
format of:

      trait:CUSTOM_MAGIC=forbidden

This will be transformed into required=!CUSTOM_MAGIC when the traits
are assembled into a request to GET /allocation_candidates.

Implements blueprint forbidden-traits-in-nova

Change-Id: I31e609aef47d2fea03f279e4bfdd30f072d062b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:32:57.000000000', 'message': "Improve API method logging

We have tracing in the wsgi code to log the method being called,
but since we are just formatting the function object into a string,
we end up with the less than friendly output of:

Calling method '<bound method VolumeController.delete of
<cinder.api.v3.volumes.VolumeController object at 0x7f9f14f86dd0>>'

This changes the logging to extract the actual name of the method
being called. It also removes some unnecessary string coersion.

Change-Id: I3a0a5973a1798a7fcf25c4288b9cbef1195f7015
"}]
commit_message:
Improve API method logging

We have tracing in the wsgi code to log the method being called,
but since we are just formatting the function object into a string,
we end up with the less than friendly output of:

Calling method '<bound method VolumeController.delete of
<cinder.api.v3.volumes.VolumeController object at 0x7f9f14f86dd0>>'

This changes the logging to extract the actual name of the method
being called. It also removes some unnecessary string coersion.

Change-Id: I3a0a5973a1798a7fcf25c4288b9cbef1195f7015

Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 5

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-live_migration_abort_start
* instance-live_migration_abort_end
* instance-shutdown-start
* instance-shutdown-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

refactors the sample files:

* instance-snapshot-start
* instance-snapshot-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionSnapshotPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I762b619c4410e3ff4a3660fc318832f81f523c05

subject: Revert "debootstrap: Call update-initramfs explicitly"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19578, 'name': 'Olivier Bourdon', 'email': 'olivierbourdon38@gmail.com', 'username': 'olivierbourdon38'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-04-17 16:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-04-17 21:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I have *no* idea why this breaks things, but have independently confirmed it does.  I reverted this, made a vhd image, uploaded it to RAX and gets a network on boot again.  This also broke ARM64; in that case I have reverted back to 2.12.1 and rebuilt the images and they started working again too.

This does *not* replicate in my cloud (rdocloud) or, it would seem, in the nodepool-functional tests.  Timing has been suggested; but the arm64 cloud is not particularly fast; and neither is nested emulation boots in the func tests.  rax is xen and linaro is kvm, so that doesn't match up either.

I have put udev settle's into the initramfs and this doesn't help.  As far as I can tell, systemd ends up configured the same way with dependencies between the glean@eth0.service and the underlying network .device unit; which means the udev rules have triggered.  

In fact, I have taken the initramfs from a working Xenial build, copied it into a build that doesn't work and glean *still* does not work.  So it does not actually seem to be something within the initramfs because even a known working one does not activate glean at boot.  

So far, after almost 3 days of looking I have not diagnosed a root cause.  This is very frustrating, but in the mean time all our images are getting older and older.  We also have pip10 to contend with.

Despite my general reticence to commit things we don't understand, in this case, I think we need to take the practical approach and take our empirical findings, and investigate this at another time."}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Strangely enough, I had been notifying this 2 weeks ago to the original committer of the patch without any success'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have done a "good" build, with this revert in place, and a "bad" build and stashed the build logs, dumps of files in resulting images, copies of the initrd and dumps of the initrd contents into

 http://people.redhat.com/~iwienand/562004/

I have also stashed the resulting .qcow's on nb01.o.o:/opt/ianw/562004

I'd welcome anyone checking the work to see if they can pick out what is going wrong here'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-04-18 21:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-18 21:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Revert "debootstrap: Call update-initramfs explicitly"

This currently breaks glean on rackspace, revert until we can figure
out why that is.

This reverts commit 43bc352c5977272ceadc1ca44d96c086cad59f5c.

Change-Id: Iae88a3b0457bab0b8f0fd1febf58732ca95e5dc9
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Override ovsdb_timeout default value in ovs_cleanup tool

In case when there is a lot of ports to clean in bridge, default
ovsdb_timeout which is set for 10 seconds is not enough.
This patch overrides default 10 seconds timeout in neutron-ovs-cleanup
tool to 600 seconds.
600 seconds value was tested experimentally on my dev environment for
at least 10000 ports in bridge.

In case when user will have more ports to delete with this script,
it will be required to increase this ovsdb_timeout value in
configuration.

Change-Id: I79a554acdb1d6d61903be0c42d0215d302884e93
Closes-Bug: #1763604

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 4

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-volume_attach-start
* instance-volume_attach-end
* instance-volume_attach-error
* instance-volume_detach-start
* instance-volume_detach-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionVolumePayload sample data.

and refactor:

* instance-volume_swap-start
* instance-volume_swap-end
* instance-volume_swap-error

notifications to use a common InstanceActionVolumeSwapPayload sample data

Change-Id: I51fd194ac3b95be96db2676b4abf3df5a14d0faa

Rather than capturing the output of commands so we can report it in an
error message, just use check_call() and let the output go to the

commit_message:
simplify error handling in generate command

Rather than capturing the output of commands so we can report it in an
error message, just use check_call() and let the output go to the
console or job log.

Change-Id: Ib67b33ce3a9446bb31a633fc25e0bab9604ab375
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 13:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix possible TypeError in VIF.fixed_ips

The VIF['network'] field can be initialized to None and therefore
a later call to VIF.fixed_ips() could raise a TypeError. This problem
was visible during AttachInterfacesTestJSON tempest test case when
nova tried to emit instance.interfacae_attach notification.

This patch checks makes sure that if VIF['network'] is None then
VIF.fixed_ips() return an empty list instead of raising a TypeError.

Change-Id: Ib285d874b19be5bc1dbcd1d2af32e461f67e34cb
Closes-Bug: #1737201
(cherry picked from commit 553f2edde596348ca5447588c5a0b06f3b6be286)
(cherry picked from commit 4eff70621146d0ddca19b8e22c76d8ee3d043aed)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix possible TypeError in VIF.fixed_ips

The VIF['network'] field can be initialized to None and therefore
a later call to VIF.fixed_ips() could raise a TypeError. This problem
was visible during AttachInterfacesTestJSON tempest test case when
nova tried to emit instance.interfacae_attach notification.

This patch checks makes sure that if VIF['network'] is None then
VIF.fixed_ips() return an empty list instead of raising a TypeError.

Change-Id: Ib285d874b19be5bc1dbcd1d2af32e461f67e34cb
Closes-Bug: #1737201
(cherry picked from commit 553f2edde596348ca5447588c5a0b06f3b6be286)
(cherry picked from commit 4eff70621146d0ddca19b8e22c76d8ee3d043aed)

commit_message:
libvirt: mask InjectionInfo.admin_pass

Logging network information and the admin password
for guest instances is not ideal, so let's not do it.

Change-Id: I328ba88b128c6c125e65d850ed7a6e57049dc7e2
Closes-Bug: #1737207
(cherry picked from commit 6839630e86d958dcda8585664586754d419363a7)

commit_message:
ovs: raise RuntimeError in _get_dp if id is None

If the switch misbehaves, we may receive None from db_get_val. In this
case, int() on the return value will raise TypeError which is not
expected by callers and may result in ovs agent crash.

Instead of bubbling up the TypeError exception, we raise RuntimeError if
datapath id is None.

Change-Id: I53bea00b9a7302d694b8066e969c894bf64cb2d4
Closes-Bug: #1731494

commit_message:
use plugin common utils from neutron-lib

A bulk of the public APIs that are part of neutron.plugins.common.utils
were rehomed into neutron-lib with [1] and the remaining with [2].

This patch consumes [1] by:
- Removing the rehomed code from neutron.
- Removing the UTs that are no longer applicable.
- Leaving the functions in [2][3] in neutron.plugins.common.utils until
we release [2][3] and can consume it at which point we should be able to
remove the utils module.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] Iabb155b5d2d0ec6104ebee5dd42cf292bdf3ec61
[2] I2c0e4ef03425ba0bb2651ae3e68d6c8cde7b8f90
[3] I73f5e8ad7a1a83392094db846d18964d811b8bb2

Change-Id: I1d63cbea463e92e1d2e053f8e1a564ed52cb84f8

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 6

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-soft_delete-start
* instance-soft_delete-end
* instance-suspend-start
* instance-suspend-end
* instance-trigger_crash_dump-start
* instance-trigger_crash_dump-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I8c31f44a3a3460e044ff73e0779a08ae49133f64

[{'created': '2018-04-09 01:05:35.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid showing password in log

per bug indicated, the password is shown in the log.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L295
indicated auth_password can be masked through mask_password method.

Change-Id: I725eea1866642b40cc6b065ed0e8aefb91ca2889
Closes-Bug: 1761054
(cherry picked from commit 1b61d6c08c7c86834acab45320230824b88d529c)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid showing password in log

per bug indicated, the password is shown in the log.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L295
indicated auth_password can be masked through mask_password method.

Change-Id: I725eea1866642b40cc6b065ed0e8aefb91ca2889
Closes-Bug: 1761054
(cherry picked from commit 1b61d6c08c7c86834acab45320230824b88d529c)

commit_message:
Use promotion process for diskimage-builder

Since diskimage-builder is no longer under the tripleo umbrella, it's
time to use it from the promotion process rather than from current.

Related-Bug: #1765123
Change-Id: I7422a75cb7d2dc5bccc289c9da0bfb3b4529a725

commit_message:
Make ansible error message clearer

Given classic drivers are deprecated, it no longer makes sense to log
the driver name here. Hardcode it to point at the ansible deploy
interface instead.

Change-Id: If079f9e9f3e56f730deaf06b0b506b5a48d2ffae

commit_message:
Fix json schema nullable to add None to ENUM

The JSON Schema validation implementation of nullable(), which makes
values possible to be null was not adding None to the enum if it exists.
This causes validation to fail on ``None`` especially in the case of
keystone's boolean parameter_type implementation. ``nullable()`` now
adds ``None`` to the enum if the enum exists.

Closes-Bug: #1763824
Change-Id: I176fa90df63049661413c445554dba9b7d87272a

subject: Fix listing of instances above API max_limit
messages:
[{'account_id': 13478, 'date': '2018-02-13 15:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-13 15:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this is appropriate as a stable branch backport since it changes the behavior of the CLI. If you want to list all servers, then pass --limit -1."}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:27:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't think this is appropriate as a stable branch backport since
 > it changes the behavior of the CLI. If you want to list all
 > servers, then pass --limit -1.

The --limit -1 doesn't work without this fix either."}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Let me explain why I think the backport should be accepted.

The "behavior change" here is actually rather "fix of known bug documented in the help text". If it wasn't described in the help text there would be nothing stopping us from merging this backport?
The loop which was supposed to run multiple queries until all VMs were listed was already there. It was just broken and never ran more than one time. It worked the same (wrong) for `nova list` and `nova list --limit -1`.
The result of this bug was that the list of VMs was cut off at the `max_limit` level without any hint for the user that there are more entries in the DB. I think it's quite unlikely that someone would rely on that behavior.'}, {'account_id': 13478, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:14:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think it's quite unlikely that someone would rely on that behavior.

You underestimate what people do with publicly available officially supported clients."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-02-18 14:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jacek:

> It worked the same (wrong) for `nova list` and `nova list --limit -1`.

Please explain how `limit -1` was broken. It looks like this patch doesn't affect `limit -1` at all."}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-03-06 09:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> @Jacek:
 > 
 > > It worked the same (wrong) for `nova list` and `nova list --limit
 > -1`.
 > 
 > Please explain how `limit -1` was broken. It looks like this patch
 > doesn't affect `limit -1` at all.

I'm not sure how this happened but I can't reproduce the problem now. It seems to work as expected with `--limit -1`."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-18 20:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 15:25:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix listing of instances above API max_limit

Output of `nova list` command contained only `max_limit` entries even
when there were more. The list needs to be obtained in multiple
requests and the paging loop was terminated prematurely.

Change-Id: I4194e6d5e34ecc0ac704851c08bb895e223aa850
Closes-Bug: 1743532
(cherry picked from commit eff607ccef91d09052d58f6798f68d67404f51ce)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listing of instances above API max_limit

Output of `nova list` command contained only `max_limit` entries even
when there were more. The list needs to be obtained in multiple
requests and the paging loop was terminated prematurely.

Change-Id: I4194e6d5e34ecc0ac704851c08bb895e223aa850
Closes-Bug: 1743532
(cherry picked from commit eff607ccef91d09052d58f6798f68d67404f51ce)

commit_message:
Gate/Dev: RPM and structure improvements

This PS restores the use of the distro provided docker for RPM based
distros. It also removes the roles subdirectory from the playbooks
and replaces it with a symlink for local dev use.

Change-Id: Ic11adb85813e92488f5ebbe6714ad7da8d3938e2

In course of normal operation, the backend snapshot
name is associated with the the ID of the snapshot instance
in manila.

However, when a share is replicated or is being migrated,
the backend snapshot is not renamed. Instead, we simply
store the original name in the "provider_location" field of
the snapshot model.

Fix revert-to-snapshot methods to identify snapshots by
"provider_location"s rather than the instance IDs.

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix revert-to-snapshot

In course of normal operation, the backend snapshot
name is associated with the the ID of the snapshot instance
in manila.

However, when a share is replicated or is being migrated,
the backend snapshot is not renamed. Instead, we simply
store the original name in the "provider_location" field of
the snapshot model.

Fix revert-to-snapshot methods to identify snapshots by
"provider_location"s rather than the instance IDs.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4900c7aecc3da6640ea9c0d4d08012ff5b68cc58
Closes-Bug: #1694768
(cherry picked from commit bd47f93007227719e8b9eebbef9767d27025a236)
(cherry picked from commit 038eb7be4fa75fd7b8c2ad2a69f831e7186dbb9f)
(cherry picked from commit c789d64a8aa36b796b3ad62f7755726082be2906)

commit_message:
Mask password when logging connection_info during swap volume

The BDM connection_info dict can contain credentials so we should
mask those when logging.

Change-Id: I5d3cbb609ff4e716df67953a2372ccb98dd0dd9b
Closes-Bug: #1685678

commit_message:
Add actions to Elastic Curator configuration

This ps updates Curator with reference actions for deleting and
snapshotting Elasticsearch indices and also modifies Curator
to account for Elasticsearch auth and hostname configuration via
endpoint lookup

Change-Id: Ic68a2506c2ea96fc7269a7bb639ebba9c9b1ef20

commit_message:
Initialize 'result' variable in functional.base

Initialize 'result' variable as None in the method of
functional.base.BaseTestCase.openstack to avoid UnboundLocalError
when exception is raised.

Change-Id: Id324d1b4395b23dfe7eb5e9d977c67ce6dbc22f7
Closes-bug: 1762717

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 18:18:08.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 19:20:32.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9
(cherry picked from commit 67391f1f0f30172190882e7d3f4a4ddc271dfa00)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9
(cherry picked from commit 67391f1f0f30172190882e7d3f4a4ddc271dfa00)

commit_message:
Remove custom zuul jobs

There are now centralized zuul jobs for nodejs[1]. Removing our custom zuul
configuration.

This patch also updates the docs for the new docs requirements.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528082/

Change-Id: Icfffc1aafa9e5c81a291e43d405539baa5f682cd

commit_message:
Remove several test dependencies

* oslotest

  We are using just one fixture class(with only one useful code-line) from
  oslotest library. To reduce inheritors and simplify readability of the
  code, let's remove oslotest dependency.

  NOTE: coverage job will fail at master change with trying to import
        oslotest. To fix this issue oslotest is temporary added to `cover`
        tox env and will be removed in follow-up change

* testscenarios

  We do not use this dependency now (or even ever?!)

* coverage

  This library was used before we switched to pytest. Now, all we need
  is pytest-cov

Change-Id: Id0d52f928e067ced5bf4613c291019529b43fbbf

Pike is broken for a different reason, but this could potentially work as fix for that bug as well. https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1760931'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-10 19:46:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
