I preferred the first one TBH, but if people are going to block on that then we have other options that don't involve duplicating all of the code."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-04-10 21:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-04-10 22:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-04-11 18:58:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)

I am fine with any of the three solutions purposed here. I just want to make sure that we fix the Senlin integration in Queens sooner, rather than later.

If you guys let me know what you prefer. I'll update my commit."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-04-18 16:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)

So <component>_api_version is something the opentacksdk uses to determine the version of the api to use. You have a couple of examples here:
https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/config/defaults.json

What is happening, and this is a bug, or issue with the openstacksdk is that in older versions this was never being set by default. So the openstacksdk would try to make a call without appending the version. 

This was never an issue before, as we were using the senlinclient, that just proxies the connection to the openstacksdk, but it always set the version before doing so.
https://github.com/openstack/python-senlinclient/blob/master/senlinclient/plugin.py#L36'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-18 17:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 06:39:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing Senlin incompatibility with openstacksdk 0.11.x

When running Heat with OpenstackSDK 0.11.3 (or older)
no clustering version is being passed on, causing the
call to Senlin to fail with the following error message.
> Unknown version in URI from

With this patch we always set the api version for clustering.

commit_message:
Fixing Senlin incompatibility with openstacksdk 0.11.x

When running Heat with OpenstackSDK 0.11.3 (or older)
no clustering version is being passed on, causing the
call to Senlin to fail with the following error message.
> Unknown version in URI from

With this patch we always set the api version for clustering.

Change-Id: I61876b599373c5794bb9edb2088b15d21f7584e2
Closes-Bug: #1760932

commit_message:
OSH-Infra: Update labels for chart components

This ps adds more granular node selectors for the charts in osh
infra to match what is currently done in osh

Change-Id: I8957a95053b9fb3ea329fd37ff049cd223a7695d

commit_message:
NetApp E-series: Fix provisioned_capacity_gb

Currently, NetApp E-series drivers (iSCSI and FC) are incorrectly
reporting the total physical used size as the provisioned_capacity_gb.
This patch fixes the calculation of this attribute by summing the
user-visible capacity of all the volumes present in the backend and
reporting the result as the provisioning_capacity_gb.

(cherry picked from commit f905253b9443db1870c3d2b7b70e032bb089efa0)
Change-Id: I1471ecfffe340dafb1c95bac5eaff79cde650955
Closes-Bug: #1718739

Old logs were gone so I rebased this.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-03-27 16:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It would be nice to exercise the new method in test runs before this merges.  Will that happen if you make this patch depend on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543950/ ?'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-03-28 07:03:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It would be nice to exercise the new method in test runs before
 > this merges.  Will that happen if you make this patch depend on
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543950/ ?


I don't think that would make the new method execute. Because, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543950/ tells to use the CentOS image only when driver type is cephfsnfs and test type is scenario which is not the case in any of the current Zuul jobs. 

I don't know if this would be the most appropriate, but I can put up a patch that would make a new dummy test, that passes if centos-based glance image is created successfully, a part of current scenario tests. Once we see that test passing, I can abandon that patch altogether and we can proceed with this one."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

That sounds like a good approach.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-04-05 14:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> That sounds like a good approach.

The exercise method works fine - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557652/'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-04-18 17:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 11047, 'date': '2018-04-18 17:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-04-18 18:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add a method to download and create a CentOS 7 image

The image is needed for scenario testing of Manila with CephFS as
backend. And download the image piece by piece where each piece is
of the size 100 MB to prevent overloading the memory.

Change-Id: Ib7101c59a4e955c7bc2aaa671d342169d6f0976d
Signed-off-by: Rishabh Dave <ridave@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refactor so broker adds filler shard range when needed

Encapsulate synthesis of filler shard range in ContainerBroker where
own shard range can be used as template.

Change-Id: I5b41804d2ab547c6fc504999c5ef2ed6d575b479

commit_message:
Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
(cherry picked from commit 076687f35e324ead5fdca7650a1e720b9ce0c81b)

[{'created': '2018-03-20 19:57:58.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using hasattr() on troveclient resources for py3 porting

troveclient resources use the lazy-loading feature, which causes problems
for calling hasttr() on the object. copy.deepcopy() also use hasattr(),
and results in infinite loops. hasattr() will ignore any exceptions under
Python 2.x, but reraise them under Python 3, this is reason why the related
test cases passed under Python 2.x and keep failing under Python 3. This
patch fixes and should be the last one to fix the py35 gate jobs.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: I97492605047a986d3075a8b5f22ecbfdb3af8aca
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 721da6ac3e34f98606672c0f3f52a240e96cb860)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using hasattr() on troveclient resources for py3 porting

troveclient resources use the lazy-loading feature, which causes problems
for calling hasttr() on the object. copy.deepcopy() also use hasattr(),
and results in infinite loops. hasattr() will ignore any exceptions under
Python 2.x, but reraise them under Python 3, this is reason why the related
test cases passed under Python 2.x and keep failing under Python 3. This
patch fixes and should be the last one to fix the py35 gate jobs.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: I97492605047a986d3075a8b5f22ecbfdb3af8aca
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 721da6ac3e34f98606672c0f3f52a240e96cb860)

[{'created': '2018-03-20 19:57:58.000000000', 'message': "Use for loop instead of map to modify iterables

Previously we use map() to apply changes to every item in a iterable
object, but this is not a proper usage. And in Python3, map() will
return a map iterator object, changes will not be applied immediately,
as we're not iterating the map object, changes will never be applied.
Changing to for loop instead fixes.

"}]
commit_message:
Use for loop instead of map to modify iterables

Previously we use map() to apply changes to every item in a iterable
object, but this is not a proper usage. And in Python3, map() will
return a map iterator object, changes will not be applied immediately,
as we're not iterating the map object, changes will never be applied.
Changing to for loop instead fixes.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: Iebbfaca67cda72300636e51686bac3b1513b127d
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f00207f7ca4ab1fab1f733b2860b242b393035)

- use dict.items() instead of dict.iteritems() for dict iteration;

commit_message:
Fix str and dict usages in unittests for Python3

- use six.text_type instead of unicode for assertion;
- use dict.items() instead of dict.iteritems() for dict iteration;
- use six.text_type to capture exception messages, the 'message' attribute
  is no longer existing;
- dict.keys() returns a dict_keys object under Python3 which cannot be
  reversed, explicitly convert it to a list.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: I5d31397b7bfe08b504ee5b9cd4ff894031f66c2b
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 996e134a1c3b903ed38eb355fe4447690a10ed66)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 10:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Add 'close' method to api_nb

Now there are cases in which the assumption that api_nb does not close
are not valid any more.
So, we need a way to release resources we acquire in a programmable
manner (mainly stop the subscriber thread)

Change-Id: Icd9e268a0f71bb8dc571d0e33c54f489685dd9f3
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 13:03:12.000000000', 'message': "Add 'close' method to api_nb

Now there are cases in which the assumption that api_nb does not close
are not valid any more, as external apps may use the api_nb as well.
Currently the external apps that use the api_nb do not enable the 
pubsub, but once this behavior is changed, we will need to support
releasing resources, namely the subscriber thread. If we fail to do so,
the thread will remain and our app will not exit.
Also, a good code writing dictates that for any resource you acquire
one must have a way of releasing it...

Change-Id: Icd9e268a0f71bb8dc571d0e33c54f489685dd9f3
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'close' method to api_nb

Now there are cases in which the assumption that api_nb does not close
are not valid any more, as external apps may use the api_nb as well.
Currently the external apps that use the api_nb do not enable the 
pubsub, but once this behavior is changed, we will need to support
releasing resources, namely the subscriber thread. If we fail to do so,
the thread will remain and our app will not exit.
Also, a good code writing dictates that for any resource you acquire
one must have a way of releasing it...

Change-Id: Icd9e268a0f71bb8dc571d0e33c54f489685dd9f3

commit_message:
Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Change-Id: Iec6be0b99e84b0c89f791c3c9694fe10f3a1e7db
(cherry picked from commit 785d1b2b38805e35bf344792342b255aedfa3549)

I have now :)

```
Ran 1 molecule tests successfully
molecule finish: runtests after 461.95 seconds
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ summary ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
  molecule: commands succeeded
  congratulations :)
```

Interestingly I hit the issue you were having in CI, twice. I had a quick poke with strace but couldn't see anything obvious. On the third attempt it worked:

    TASK [kolla-openstack : Ensure the ironic inspector kernel and ramdisk are downloaded] ***
    skipping: [centos-7] => (item={u'url': None, u'dest': u'ironic-agent.kernel'})
    skipping: [centos-7] => (item={u'url': None, u'dest': u'ironic-agent.initramfs'})
    skipping: [ubuntu-1604] => (item={u'url': None, u'dest': u'ironic-agent.kernel'})
    skipping: [ubuntu-1604] => (item={u'url': None, u'dest': u'ironic-agent.initramfs'})
    
    TASK [kolla-openstack : Ensure the ironic inspector kernel and ramdisk are copied] ***
    changed: [centos-7] => (item={u'path': u'/tmp/ironic-agent.kernel', u'dest': u'ironic-agent.kernel'})

Add support for configuring InfluxDB

Required to use a vintage version of InfluxDB with a different
config file format.

commit_message:
FC: refactor fczm utils decorators to functions

This patch changes the Fibre Channel Zone Manager
utility decorators to functions.   Those functions
now have to be called manually.   The intention of this
is to unify how the FC drivers are to be declared and
used vs. the iSCSI.  No more magic decorators for FC
drivers only.

Change-Id: I8e6e964e3694654b8ba93fe432a0dd49fa5e1df0

Define an abstract job devstack base that does not require any
project apart from devstack. This job defines basic devstack_localrc
settings that are common to any devstack job (mostly to work with
infra) and devstack_services to emit "disable_all_services" so to

The variables are defined as global ones as well as host-vars for

commit_message:
Define devstack-base abstract job

Define an abstract job devstack base that does not require any
project apart from devstack. This job defines basic devstack_localrc
settings that are common to any devstack job (mostly to work with
infra) and devstack_services to emit "disable_all_services" so to
cancel any devstack default.

The variables are defined as global ones as well as host-vars for
the controller and group-vars for peer nodes, so that any
descendent job may extend them, thanks for Zuul dict merging.

Change-Id: I2cdb723f6ee209683044fecec59ff7b510a2752b

commit_message:
Add prerequisite package note to Keystone install guide

Added prerequisite package note and associated link to the main Install Guide
to the Keystone install guide. This is to ensure commands further down the
Keystone guide don't fail unexpectedly.

Change-Id: I189854fbc7f1e05945ab0002c08ee84f7bfad196
Closes-Bug: 1754413
Closes-Bug: 1754417

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 19:50:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix a migration issue of Huawei driver

While migrating volume crossing backends by the host-based way,
after data copying is done, Huawei driver's update_migrated_volume
method doesn't return the provider_location property, which
results old and new volumes' provider_locations aren't swapped as
expected, afterwards, while deleting the old volume, new volume's
provider_location will be used and the if-volume-exist-check fails
because it verifies the new volume's LUN ID actually on the old
backend, which certainly doesn't exist.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Iee27c0368522c90525a4b8ad757f9fb89dc293a0
(cherry picked from commit 011daa9b463043a15f9e97986ecce6233ac72de5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a migration issue of Huawei driver

While migrating volume crossing backends by the host-based way,
after data copying is done, Huawei driver's update_migrated_volume
method doesn't return the provider_location property, which
results old and new volumes' provider_locations aren't swapped as
expected, afterwards, while deleting the old volume, new volume's
provider_location will be used and the if-volume-exist-check fails
because it verifies the new volume's LUN ID actually on the old
backend, which certainly doesn't exist.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Iee27c0368522c90525a4b8ad757f9fb89dc293a0
(cherry picked from commit 011daa9b463043a15f9e97986ecce6233ac72de5)

commit_message:
ScaleIO Driver - include snap usage in provisioned capacity

Provisioned capacity of storage pools was not correctly accounting
for space used by snapshots.

Change-Id: I945300cac84658bbd25182ba615645af881920f8
Closes-Bug: #1724929
(cherry picked from commit 64180530c14e1d0829788eda1ccb0efc938fbd8e)

commit_message:
doc: avoid RST files in subdirectory

We are discussing an approach on translation support in
project documents in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543220/.
In this approach POT files for RST files in subdirectory are
treated differently. In the i18n doc, atc-stats directory is
the only exception and the thing would be much simpler if it
is moved to a top directory.

tools/generatepot.sh is updated accordingly.

Also generatepot.sh is added to pep8 tox env to confirm
generatepot.sh works successfully.

Change-Id: Ia227358cf9681e8d1745f4c260fe9c97ab18a3e7

commit_message:
Use promotion process for diskimage-builder

diskimage-builder is no longer under the tripleo umbrella so we should
use the package from the tested repo instead of current.

Change-Id: Iad38eabb8380a9cf72d8690dd3f54775dec3b88f
Related-Bug: #1765123

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 19:50:36.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP: Fix reporting of provisioned_capacity_gb

The ONTAP drivers in Cinder ("7mode" and "cmode") cannot
reliably and efficiently track provisioned_capacity_gb as expected
by the Cinder scheduler.

The driver authors originally assumed that provisioned_capacity_gb
is consumed space on the backend. This results in miscalculation of
over subscription in the Cinder scheduler.

The fix adopted here is to remove this wrong reporting and rely on
calculation of the provisioned_capacity_gb in the scheduler.

Change-Id: Ic106dbcae8ceaac265b710756ab1874e445ca826
Closes-Bug: #1714209
(cherry picked from commit 42b8b7fe60ffdd7a7772dc0ab228265dc83344bc)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_7mode.py
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix reporting of provisioned_capacity_gb

The ONTAP drivers in Cinder ("7mode" and "cmode") cannot
reliably and efficiently track provisioned_capacity_gb as expected
by the Cinder scheduler.

The driver authors originally assumed that provisioned_capacity_gb
is consumed space on the backend. This results in miscalculation of
over subscription in the Cinder scheduler.

The fix adopted here is to remove this wrong reporting and rely on
calculation of the provisioned_capacity_gb in the scheduler.

Change-Id: Ic106dbcae8ceaac265b710756ab1874e445ca826
Closes-Bug: #1714209
(cherry picked from commit 42b8b7fe60ffdd7a7772dc0ab228265dc83344bc)
(cherry picked from commit 558571b44d9cd2195993e42539fd2c689b179ee6)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_7mode.py

Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

(cherry picked from commit e15fff5e9d974d91839c74f4ac8b6fe6abc68ddc)

commit_message:
Dell EMC PS: Fix over-subscription ratio stats

Fixed the provisioned_capacity_gb to use the VolumeReportedSpace
to calculate the over-subscription ratio stats in the Dell EMC
PS volume driver.

Closes Bug: #1719659

Change-Id: I2caa5f2763ec343b0bc875e707924ff9b6424ce5
(cherry picked from commit 761f0c3e66691e6f5c683a63a81beccbbca1cacf)

commit_message:
Brocade: Add HTTP connection cleanup

Method for get device mapping opens
connection to the switch but does not
close the connection.  Add finally
block to close the session.

Closes Bug: #1718762

Change-Id: Ic4c7fd66858039db3f9d09a0babd5601b25a95e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 20:42:29.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9
(cherry picked from commit 67391f1f0f30172190882e7d3f4a4ddc271dfa00)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9
(cherry picked from commit 67391f1f0f30172190882e7d3f4a4ddc271dfa00)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Mixed-1]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 07c154f3edfce3801ada7b2c2392b62b60600772)
Change-Id: Idf93d01521af4ae08702168d68941025cffeca44
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Constrain the pip/setuptools/wheel versions in the venvs

The installation of these packages are currently not constrained,
resulting in inconsistent experiences at deploy time.

This patch ensures that the venv preparation process properly
constrains the installation so that results are consistent.

Change-Id: I744e43d8a1b85d5bdaf7019a6420a39222911330
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4e0053c833d821bb7086c8feb9e44eb927c23fab
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Replace random with SystemRandom for RandomString

it might be theoretically possible to infer the state of
standard Python's RNG in a long-running heat-engine service
from multiple created RandomString resources.

Let's use the random.SystemRandom (and os.urandom) for
OS::Heat::RandomString instead.

Change-Id: Iac5c03176fc8bae95ada883621196bd9cb453be3
Closes-Bug: #1745931
(cherry picked from commit 41605aaac1ec9fb0020c663b703255ee2cf3615f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 22:50:02.000000000', 'message': 'ZFSSA implement "Enhance iSCSI multipath support"

A typical ZFSSA iSCSI deployment involves a ZFSSA cluster with two
control heads, two storage pools, and two network interfaces. Under
normal operation, one of the pools and one of the network interfaces
would be owned by one control head, and the others by the other control
head. This provides a form of "active/active" operation.

Cinder would be configured with two backends - one pointing to the pool
and an iSCSI target (group) normally served by the first head, and the
other the second head.

In the event of a failure of one control head, the other head will
"takeover" its storage pool and network interface, allowing service to
continue (perhaps with reduced performance) until the problem head is
restored, at which time the resources would be "given back".

In the takeover scenario, a sendtargets iSCSI discovery to the portal
address normally associated with the failed head will be serviced by the
other head, and it will return BOTH targets. os-brick, when configured
to use multipath, interprets this as both targets being basically
equivalent, and will use either one of them to determine the
host/controller/target/LUN ID to use to find SCSI devices. When the same
LU number is assigned to LUNs in both pools that are presented to the
same compute node, it can cause a LUN belonging to one VM to to
connected to a different VM.

Whilst full multipath support is not implemented in the ZFSSA driver,
using multipath on compute nodes provides some utility, even with only a
single path (notably the I/O can be queued during a transient interruption
(cluster takeover, network switch reboot, etc.). To support this scenario,
whilst avoiding the above problem, this change implements "enhanced multipath
support" [1] to provide explicit target info to os-brick (but only
supporting a single path). This could be expanded to full multipath support
in the future.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/iscsi-multipath-enhancement

Change-Id: I6402a6bc2a0d51efd3b60d93c11c1a81e8a73269
Closes-Bug: 1762584

support" [1] to provide explicit target info to os-brick (but only
supporting a single path). This could be expanded to full multipath support
in the future.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/iscsi-multipath-enhancement

commit_message:
ZFSSA implement "Enhance iSCSI multipath support"

A typical ZFSSA iSCSI deployment involves a ZFSSA cluster with two
control heads, two storage pools, and two network interfaces. Under
normal operation, one of the pools and one of the network interfaces
would be owned by one control head, and the others by the other control
head. This provides a form of "active/active" operation.

Cinder would be configured with two backends - one pointing to the pool
and an iSCSI target (group) normally served by the first head, and the
other the second head.

In the event of a failure of one control head, the other head will
"takeover" its storage pool and network interface, allowing service to
continue (perhaps with reduced performance) until the problem head is
restored, at which time the resources would be "given back".

In the takeover scenario, a sendtargets iSCSI discovery to the portal
address normally associated with the failed head will be serviced by the
other head, and it will return BOTH targets. os-brick, when configured
to use multipath, interprets this as both targets being basically
equivalent, and will use either one of them to determine the
host/controller/target/LUN ID to use to find SCSI devices. When the same
LU number is assigned to LUNs in both pools that are presented to the
same compute node, it can cause a LUN belonging to one VM to to
connected to a different VM.

Whilst full multipath support is not implemented in the ZFSSA driver,
using multipath on compute nodes provides some utility, even with only a
single path (notably the I/O can be queued during a transient interruption
(cluster takeover, network switch reboot, etc.). To support this scenario,
whilst avoiding the above problem, this change implements "enhanced multipath
support" [1] to provide explicit target info to os-brick (but only
supporting a single path). This could be expanded to full multipath support
in the future.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/iscsi-multipath-enhancement

Change-Id: I6402a6bc2a0d51efd3b60d93c11c1a81e8a73269
Closes-Bug: 1762584

[{'created': '2018-04-10 20:00:41.000000000', 'message': 'ZFSSA accept pool stats when cluster node stripped

When a node in a ZFSSA cluster fails, storage pools and network
interfaces associated with it get "taken over" by the other node. In
this scenario, the identity of the node does not match the "owner" of
the pool. Currently, the cinder volume drivers consider this to be a
failure. With this change, it will not be considered a failure, so long
as the cluster node is stripped. If the cluster is operating normally,
the node responding to API requests must be the node that owns the pool.

Change-Id: I073cf97bc65f93acd5732c9b7072c7130e6b248f
Closes-Bug: 1762777
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 21:49:58.000000000', 'message': 'ZFSSA accept pool stats when cluster node stripped

the pool. Currently, the cinder volume drivers consider this to be a
failure. With this change, it will not be considered a failure, so long
as the cluster node is stripped. If the cluster is operating normally,
the node responding to API requests must be the node that owns the pool.

Change-Id: I073cf97bc65f93acd5732c9b7072c7130e6b248f
Closes-Bug: 1762777

commit_message:
ZFSSA accept pool stats when cluster node stripped

When a node in a ZFSSA cluster fails, storage pools and network
interfaces associated with it get "taken over" by the other node. In
this scenario, the identity of the node does not match the "owner" of
the pool. Currently, the cinder volume drivers consider this to be a
failure. With this change, it will not be considered a failure, so long
as the cluster node is stripped. If the cluster is operating normally,
the node responding to API requests must be the node that owns the pool.

Change-Id: I073cf97bc65f93acd5732c9b7072c7130e6b248f
Closes-Bug: 1762777

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 02:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'ZFSSA implement "Enhance iSCSI multipath support"

A typical ZFSSA iSCSI deployment involves a ZFSSA cluster with two
control heads, two storage pools, and two network interfaces. Under
normal operation, one of the pools and one of the network interfaces
would be owned by one control head, and the others by the other control
head. This provides a form of "active/active" operation.

Cinder would be configured with two backends - one pointing to the pool
and an iSCSI target (group) normally served by the first head, and the
other the second head.

In the event of a failure of one control head, the other head will
"takeover" its storage pool and network interface, allowing service to
continue (perhaps with reduced performance) until the problem head is
restored, at which time the resources would be "given back".

In the takeover scenario, a sendtargets iSCSI discovery to the portal
address normally associated with the failed head will be serviced by the
other head, and it will return BOTH targets. os-brick, when configured
to use multipath, interprets this as both targets being basically
equivalent, and will use either one of them to determine the
host/controller/target/LUN ID to use to find SCSI devices. When the same
LU number is assigned to LUNs in both pools that are presented to the
same compute node, it can cause a LUN belonging to one VM to to
connected to a different VM.

Whilst full multipath support is not implemented in the ZFSSA driver,
using multipath on compute nodes provides some utility, even with only a
single path (notably the I/O can be queued during a transient interruption
(cluster takeover, network switch reboot, etc.). To support this scenario,
whilst avoiding the above problem, this change implements "enhanced multipath
support" [1] to provide explicit target info to os-brick (but only
supporting a single path). This could be expanded to full multipath support
in the future.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/iscsi-multipath-enhancement

Change-Id: I6402a6bc2a0d51efd3b60d93c11c1a81e8a73269
Closes-Bug: 1762584
(cherry picked from commit a412e3279070140bfd4611d25cc6efc3b1b533c1)
'}]
commit_message:
ZFSSA implement "Enhance iSCSI multipath support"

A typical ZFSSA iSCSI deployment involves a ZFSSA cluster with two
control heads, two storage pools, and two network interfaces. Under
normal operation, one of the pools and one of the network interfaces
would be owned by one control head, and the others by the other control
head. This provides a form of "active/active" operation.

Cinder would be configured with two backends - one pointing to the pool
and an iSCSI target (group) normally served by the first head, and the
other the second head.

In the event of a failure of one control head, the other head will
"takeover" its storage pool and network interface, allowing service to
continue (perhaps with reduced performance) until the problem head is
restored, at which time the resources would be "given back".

In the takeover scenario, a sendtargets iSCSI discovery to the portal
address normally associated with the failed head will be serviced by the
other head, and it will return BOTH targets. os-brick, when configured
to use multipath, interprets this as both targets being basically
equivalent, and will use either one of them to determine the
host/controller/target/LUN ID to use to find SCSI devices. When the same
LU number is assigned to LUNs in both pools that are presented to the
same compute node, it can cause a LUN belonging to one VM to to
connected to a different VM.

Whilst full multipath support is not implemented in the ZFSSA driver,
using multipath on compute nodes provides some utility, even with only a
single path (notably the I/O can be queued during a transient interruption
(cluster takeover, network switch reboot, etc.). To support this scenario,
whilst avoiding the above problem, this change implements "enhanced multipath
support" [1] to provide explicit target info to os-brick (but only
supporting a single path). This could be expanded to full multipath support
in the future.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/iscsi-multipath-enhancement

Change-Id: I6402a6bc2a0d51efd3b60d93c11c1a81e8a73269
Closes-Bug: 1762584
(cherry picked from commit a412e3279070140bfd4611d25cc6efc3b1b533c1)

[{'created': '2018-04-05 14:19:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
(cherry picked from commit 076687f35e324ead5fdca7650a1e720b9ce0c81b)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
(cherry picked from commit 076687f35e324ead5fdca7650a1e720b9ce0c81b)

commit_message:
Fix repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle effectiveness

The repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle is supposed to trigger
a rebuild of the venvs, but currently it does nothing.

This patch fixes that, making it possible to rebuild the
venvs without having to rebuild the wheels too.

Change-Id: I61db1f5555cba2c659ff09d8369ce3c31b011b5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-02 18:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP: Fix revert-to-snapshot

In course of normal operation, the backend snapshot
name is associated with the the ID of the snapshot instance
in manila.

However, when a share is replicated or is being migrated,
the backend snapshot is not renamed. Instead, we simply
store the original name in the "provider_location" field of
the snapshot model.

Fix revert-to-snapshot methods to identify snapshots by
"provider_location"s rather than the instance IDs.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4900c7aecc3da6640ea9c0d4d08012ff5b68cc58
Closes-Bug: #1694768
(cherry picked from commit bd47f93007227719e8b9eebbef9767d27025a236)
(cherry picked from commit 038eb7be4fa75fd7b8c2ad2a69f831e7186dbb9f)

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix revert-to-snapshot

In course of normal operation, the backend snapshot
name is associated with the the ID of the snapshot instance
in manila.

However, when a share is replicated or is being migrated,
the backend snapshot is not renamed. Instead, we simply
store the original name in the "provider_location" field of
the snapshot model.

Fix revert-to-snapshot methods to identify snapshots by
"provider_location"s rather than the instance IDs.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4900c7aecc3da6640ea9c0d4d08012ff5b68cc58
Closes-Bug: #1694768
(cherry picked from commit bd47f93007227719e8b9eebbef9767d27025a236)
(cherry picked from commit 038eb7be4fa75fd7b8c2ad2a69f831e7186dbb9f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 20:17:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447
(cherry picked from commit b652926eb5bbf8d5895e530474ac96bd3062a874)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we

commit_message:
Allow iteration over files dict before template stored

Due to a programming error, the files dict of a template would appear to
contain no items when iterated over prior to them being stored in the
database. (Individual items could still be accessed directly by name.)
Since this is the mechanism by which dictionaries are serialised (directly
or e.g. via items()), this resulted in an empty files dict when trying to
send the data over ReST. (The same is likely true of RPC, but we don't
generally send the files dict over RPC any more.)

Since validation occurs before the template is stored, this meant that we
could not validate a remote stack over ReST.

Change-Id: Ie7433557321c54075ad531def0247fad735d07d9
Closes-Bug: #1739447
(cherry picked from commit b652926eb5bbf8d5895e530474ac96bd3062a874)

commit_message:
Add IP addresses to infra node br-vxlan in the examples

The layer 3 agent is no longer containerised by default so the bare
metal host requires an IP to be assigned to br-vxlan

Change-Id: If3e1511546c6192f11ef1702d09772643b4fe9b7
Closes-Bug: #1761715

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib313546ac24839838c1bd88f3f41611399aacc10
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Depends-On: I674cbd45e17906448dd54acfdf7a7059880b7278
Change-Id: Iec6be0b99e84b0c89f791c3c9694fe10f3a1e7db
(cherry picked from commit 785d1b2b38805e35bf344792342b255aedfa3549)

commit_message:
Use control group for Zookeeper

Keeping with upstream kolla-ansible use the control group for Kafka. Kafka
uses the control group because it may also be used by Oslo for notifications.

Task: 6696
Story: 2001627
Change-Id: I2150c5f4d5e1396b4f597b0f7bef71f9f1ebd384

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 08:06:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova profile handle reboot faild operation

This patch fix nova profile handle reboot operation faild.
- Change reboot default 'SOFT' to 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot
can't support vm in 'error' or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 08:09:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova profile handle reboot faild

This patch fix nova profile handle reboot operation faild.
- Change reboot default 'SOFT' to 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot
can't support vm in 'error' or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.
- Change handle reboot return value, if return 'bool' value,
the node record physical_id error.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 08:16:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova profile handle reboot faild

This patch fix nova profile handle reboot operation faild.
- Change reboot default type 'SOFT' to 'HARD', nova 'SOFT'
reboot can't support vm in 'error' or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.
- Change handle reboot return value, if return 'bool' value,
the node record physical_id error when health recover action
'REBOOT' parameter.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-09 09:31:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova profile handle reboot faild

This patch fix nova profile handle reboot operation faild.
- If recover the reboot type not exist, Set reboot default
type 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot can't support vm in 'error'
or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.
- Change handle reboot return value, if return 'bool' value,
the node record physical_id error when health recover action
'REBOOT' parameter.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 01:04:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova profile handle reboot faild

This patch fix nova profile handle reboot operation faild.
- If recover the reboot type not exist, Set reboot default
type 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot can't support vm in 'error'
or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.
- Change handle reboot return value, if return 'bool' value,
the node record physical_id error when health recover action
'REBOOT' parameter.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 02:31:35.000000000', 'message': "Update node recover operation

- Change return value, If recover in 'rebuild' or 'reboot'
return bool value, if recover in 'recreate' return new server id.

- If recover the reboot type not exist, Set reboot default
type 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot can't support vm in 'error'
or 'stop' status.

- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 02:43:03.000000000', 'message': "Update node recover operation

- Change return value, If recover in 'rebuild' or 'reboot'
return bool value, if recover in 'recreate' return new server id.

- If recover the reboot type not exist, Set reboot default
type 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot can't support vm in 'error'
or 'stop' status.

- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 08:31:47.000000000', 'message': "Update node recover operation

- Change return value, return server ID and bool value.
- If recover the reboot type not exist, Set reboot default
type 'HARD', nova 'SOFT' reboot can't support vm in 'error'
or 'stop' status.
- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 08:33:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update node recover operation

- Change recover operation return value
- Change reboot type parameter
- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update node recover operation

- Change recover operation return value
- Change reboot type parameter
- Add handle reboot exception capture.

Change-Id: Ie008293fc5a7df8f8dd06c5e4a2d39d034199c5d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix export path used as volume name

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume
name. If the export path is different than the volume name, the
API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke
a fallback method that deletes the files manually. This patch fixes
that by finding the correct volume name.

Change-Id: Ice78889573a36ff5e8873a0d316ddcf180d0263f
Closes-bug: #1690954

[{'created': '2018-04-18 11:48:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove perl library from Ubuntu installs

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/238748

Change-Id: I742c4ef9a201384787d5a9aeafac4ff7b0bdc353
"}]
commit_message:
Remove perl library from Ubuntu installs

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/238748

Change-Id: I742c4ef9a201384787d5a9aeafac4ff7b0bdc353

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:35:45.000000000', 'message': "Better supports sev checking

Previously we attempted to check supports sev by running re.search
against the full log path of the log file. This meannt that the re that
roughly said: r'/neutron-' could match job logs like this:

  http://logs.openstack.org/17/553617/16/check/neutron-tempest-plugin-dvr-multinode-scenario/42fb158/job-output.txt.gz

Unfortunately that meant that all neutron logs had to support sev and if
they didn't (which job output doesn't) then we'd serve no logs to the
user if they set a log level.

We address this by switching to matching on the basename of the path and
by switching to re.match so that we only match from the beginning of the
re.

Change-Id: Ia428dc7339f06a15c58001e99ca677cb6059186b
"}]
commit_message:
Better supports sev checking

Previously we attempted to check supports sev by running re.search
against the full log path of the log file. This meannt that the re that
roughly said: r'/neutron-' could match job logs like this:

  http://logs.openstack.org/17/553617/16/check/neutron-tempest-plugin-dvr-multinode-scenario/42fb158/job-output.txt.gz

Unfortunately that meant that all neutron logs had to support sev and if
they didn't (which job output doesn't) then we'd serve no logs to the
user if they set a log level.

We address this by switching to matching on the basename of the path and
by switching to re.match so that we only match from the beginning of the
re.

Change-Id: Ia428dc7339f06a15c58001e99ca677cb6059186b

commit_message:
Workaround pip 10 issue with tox_install.sh

This commit prevents from warning that was recently promoted to error.
If tox_install.sh is to do `pip install` without further arguments,
don't execute it.

Change-Id: I0e1a1fba96072ee439f883dfa8ed48a7b51fe830

commit_message:
Check MySQL ACL before use

Ensure that the local vault unit has been granted access to
the MySQL vault database before trying to configure vault to
actually use it.

The MySQL charms provide a list of units which have been
granted access using the 'allowed_units' function on the
mysql-shared interface.

Change-Id: I4c1a7f559fcf6279a537770e76d92c01d33ced99

commit_message:
Add custom subclass to revert mapping

To be able to revert the custom mappings down by config-download, let's
add some tripleo specific subclasses which will be available in the
registry.

Change-Id: I6bd4107e8e1a6a9abc38d2dca7a91a6823f8b6c2
Related-Bug: #1758065

Standard attributes (i.e. revision_number, created_at, updated_at)
are missing in the segment resource. This is because the controller
doesn't process extensions on rendering the response. This patch
fixes it. In particular, this patch does the following:
* Process extensions when making the segment dict. This allows
  other extensions to add attributes to segment response.
* Make segment extension implement update_attributes_map.

Tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558609/

Closes-Bug: #1760902
Change-Id: I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0
(cherry picked from commit 4d84c10ba4430752bf8c1227c770fb3c4f0a1618)
"}]
commit_message:
Add standard attributes to segment resource

Standard attributes (i.e. revision_number, created_at, updated_at)
are missing in the segment resource. This is because the controller
doesn't process extensions on rendering the response. This patch
fixes it. In particular, this patch does the following:
* Process extensions when making the segment dict. This allows
  other extensions to add attributes to segment response.
* Make segment extension implement update_attributes_map.

Tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558609/

APIImpact update api reference of segments

Closes-Bug: #1760902
Change-Id: I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0
(cherry picked from commit 4d84c10ba4430752bf8c1227c770fb3c4f0a1618)

commit_message:
Update openstack-on-lxd doc for Queens

Use lxd from backports, as there there is quite a
feature jump between Xenial/main and Xenial/backports.

Update package list to include bridge-utils, which is
helpful for viewing bridge utilization.

Update host setup to include arm64 machine specs as-run.

Update bundle names to reflect the renamed file names
which now include series.

Shift post-deploy commands to ksv3, add advisory for
ksv2 usage.

Use openstack client command instead of legacy neutron
client command.

Update security group commands to catch all default
groups.

Add GUI access documentation.

Use new `openrc` instead of `novarc_ksv3` and `novarc`.

Change-Id: I7df96b4a0c2918beec24420a9bd0285f6789e3c2

subject: Fix some api tests when behind http proxy
messages:
[{'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2018-02-07 18:14:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this would mean that if anything is running on the local host on port 80 (very possible) the tests will fail.

I'd suggest specifying port 0, ie 127.0.0.1:0"}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:49:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I think port 0 (127.0.0.1:0) would probably be marginally better than port 1 (127.0.0.1:1) because nothing can listen on port 0 but in principle something could listen on port 1.

That being said I don't think port 1 has ever actually proved a problem in practice."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-02-14 10:53:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think port 0 (127.0.0.1:0) would probably be marginally better
 > than port 1 (127.0.0.1:1) because nothing can listen on port 0 but
 > in principle something could listen on port 1.
 > 
 > That being said I don't think port 1 has ever actually proved a
 > problem in practice.

I did some quick reading on port 0 and the behavior seems a little undefined - it seems it can mean both 'invalid port' and 'let the system choose a high range port' depending on the situation. So I reckoned keeping the port value you previously had might be a little more predictable. If that doesn't make sense we can change to 0 though, not a big deal. Thanks for reviewing :)"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Paul,

I think it's largely academic.

127.0.0.1:0 can *never* return anything other than connection refused (which I think is what the test wants)

 $ nc -l 127.0.0.1 0
 $ no_proxy=127.0.0.1 curl 127.0.0.1:0
* Rebuilt URL to: 127.0.0.1:0/
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* connect to 127.0.0.1 port 0 failed: Connection refused
* Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 0: Connection refused
* Closing connection 0
curl: (7) Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 0: Connection refused


Port 1 could have something bound, and could return a response (causing a test fail)

 $ nc -l 127.0.0.1 1
 $ no_proxy=127.0.0.1 curl -v 127.0.0.1:1
* Rebuilt URL to: 127.0.0.1:1/
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 1 (#0)
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:1
> User-Agent: curl/7.52.1
> Accept: */*
> 

'let the system choose a high range port': That's only the case on the server side. If your server does a 'bind' to port 0 the system will map it to some random (non-zero) unallocated port, say port 12345. If a client tries to connect to port 0 they will still get connection refused, the server hasn't really done anything with port 0, it's just a convention to say choose a port number for me. The client would need to connect to port 12345 get a response. (With the 'nc' example above you can use "lsof -i | grep LISTEN | grep -w nc" to see which random port was allocated.)

But as I say, I don't think port 1 has ever caused any problems in the real world!'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:47:03.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Looks like the v1 tests have been removed, so I guess this isn't needed anymore"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 18:07:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix some api tests when behind http proxy

A patch was submitted some time back to allow some tests to run
behind a http proxy [0]. It's unclear to me why '0.0.0.0:1' was used
rather than something like '127.0.0.1' which will be commonly in an
environment's $no_proxy variable, whereas the former will not.

Unless there's some special reason this value was used I propose
switching instances of 0.0.0.0:1 with 127.0.0.1

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316965/

Change-Id: I6aac79f9aa3529b9e1391d00ee9bbd0c7667b4c6
Closes-Bug: #1747727
"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 10:44:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some api tests when behind http proxy

These tests were originally changed to use '0.0.0.0:1' to assist with running
behind a proxy [0]. However, they will still fail unless an operator takes care
to add to add this value to their environment's $no_proxy.  A commonly used
default for no_proxy is "localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" -
so update these tests to instead use 127.0.0.1:1.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316965/

Change-Id: I6aac79f9aa3529b9e1391d00ee9bbd0c7667b4c6
Closes-Bug: #1747727
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 10:45:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some api tests when behind http proxy

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316965/

Change-Id: I6aac79f9aa3529b9e1391d00ee9bbd0c7667b4c6
Closes-Bug: #1747727
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 14:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some api tests when behind http proxy

running behind a proxy [0]. However, they will still fail unless an

Change-Id: I6aac79f9aa3529b9e1391d00ee9bbd0c7667b4c6

commit_message:
Fix some api tests when behind http proxy

These tests were originally changed to use '0.0.0.0:1' to assist with
running behind a proxy [0]. However, they will still fail unless an
operator takes care to add to add this value to their environment's
$no_proxy.  A commonly used default for no_proxy is
"localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com" - so update these
tests to instead use 127.0.0.1:1.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316965/

Change-Id: I6aac79f9aa3529b9e1391d00ee9bbd0c7667b4c6
Closes-Bug: #1747727

commit_message:
clean up test job configuration

Make the py27 and py35 jobs run the same commands by putting them into
the base testenv block.

Move the doc8 job into the pep8 environment to run with the other
linters.

Change the way we invoke sphinx to run the doctests to avoid issues
with pbr's sphinx integration. This also required removing skipdist
and usedevelop to ensure that all of the pbr-generated files needed by
sphinx exist before we run sphinx.

Change the way sphinx is invoked in the docs environment to avoid
issues with pbr's sphinx integration.

Change-Id: If8a24428eca4512a66dbb361e55cd73aa92c4da8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-04-03 20:06:00.000000000', 'message': "Add standard attributes to segment resource

Standard attributes (i.e. revision_number, created_at, updated_dat)
is missiing in the segment resource. This is because the controller
doesn't process extensions on rendering the response. This patch
fixes it. In particular, this patch does the following:
* Process extensions when making the segment dict. This allows
  other extensions to add attributes to segment response.
* Set an optional dependency between segment extensions and the
  extensions that needs to add attributes to segment (timestamp
  and revision). This ensure segment is loaded so that other
  extensions can populate its attribute map.
* Make segment extension implement update_attributes_map.

Tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558609/

APIImpact update api reference of segments

Closes-Bug: #1759959
Change-Id: I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 19:27:47.000000000', 'message': "Add standard attributes to segment resource

Change-Id: I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0
"}]
commit_message:
Add standard attributes to segment resource

Standard attributes (i.e. revision_number, created_at, updated_at)
are missing in the segment resource. This is because the controller
doesn't process extensions on rendering the response. This patch
fixes it. In particular, this patch does the following:
* Process extensions when making the segment dict. This allows
  other extensions to add attributes to segment response.
* Make segment extension implement update_attributes_map.

Tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558609/

APIImpact update api reference of segments

Closes-Bug: #1760902
Change-Id: I3c93818002c2d7753454547231ba08544b6fa1c0

commit_message:
Fixing unicode issue when to_dict is called on py2.7 env

When using non-unicode old style user id such as Gāo
Unicode error popup on py2.7 environment
Fixing it on common/context.py

Change-Id: I95e49f359410049ff5b254cd1b8ee16402c8719d
Closes-Bug: #1761629

commit_message:
Create tripleo-ha-utils project (zuul)

As described in the spec [1] merged recently, this project aims to
contain all the tools, ansible playbooks and documentation to proper
test and verify all the specific HA bits of a TripleO deployment.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/rocky/tripleo-ha-utils.html

Needed-By: I7d6c3fdd2d1f17cd8c128a971c9d765032c48fe3
Change-Id: I50c40e207e7968c3aad70f1e0d385f49324b12a2

commit_message:
Add support for using a vip for access

Add support for floating a vip across the vault units so that
clients are protected from the failure of a single unit.

Depends-On: I022a43df0a50a21df3c5f021dcd563da4d20db53
Change-Id: I836366c8f4102dafa34b8f596eab54d28f44ae9a

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Since oslo.utils provide the ability to generate the uuid string,
and some others use oslo.utils[0] too. For consistency, this ps
replaces uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid().

Change-Id: I151980c4367e6a1c6423c144bd2b2806893e21a5

Fix support for proxy URL from tempest.conf

Fix support for using HTTP proxy server to connect to
OpenStack REST API services.

Closes-Bug: #1764375

You set default API version to 2.56, but how we should overcome situation if user have older Nova version? Do we need such check?'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-04-09 10:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-04-10 09:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> You set default API version to 2.56, but how we should overcome
 > situation if user have older Nova version? Do we need such check?

Are you proposing to implement to check nova version?
Actually we can check nova version. If nova version is older than v2.56, watcher throws exception when host option is given.'}, {'account_id': 27947, 'date': '2018-04-10 09:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > You set default API version to 2.56, but how we should overcome
 > > situation if user have older Nova version? Do we need such check?
 > 
 > Are you proposing to implement to check nova version?
 > Actually we can check nova version. If nova version is older than
 > v2.56, watcher throws exception when host option is given.

I think something like note in docs or notification on service startup would be a good idea. If you prefer to throw an exception, so it would be good, too.

My idea is that if we rely on concrete version of API and its methods, then we should check availability of this version.'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-04-12 02:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27947, 'date': '2018-04-12 17:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Replace cold migration to use Nova migration API

Since Nova API v2.56, Nova migrate Server(migrate Action) API
has host option.
This patch replaces cold migration implementation to use the API.

Change-Id: Idd6ebc94f81ad5d65256c80885f2addc1aaeaae1
Implements: blueprint replace-cold-migrate-to-use-nova-migration-api

commit_message:
Other Gerrit Capabilities

This patch adds info about the ability to add
reviewers and to do small edits in the gerrit web
editor. In addition, it adds photos to the reviewing
patches section.

Story: 2001358
Task: 6783

Change-Id: Iad89df50a052decbb14073dd46d72973340c6293

Remove un-used variables

There was a whole bunch of variables that were simply not used
so this cleans it up to make configuring things much more straight
forward and less confusing.

[{'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Or fix it maybe? It works for me: do you have pypy installed?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So, what does it happen if you don't have python3 installed and you try to run tox -e py35? Or when you don't have python2 and you run tox -e py27. Does it work if you have pypy installed?"}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, Luigi Toscano.

I agree with you.

So I will change the commit message to another way :)'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

But my point is that `tox -e pypy` failing if pypy is not installed is not a reason to remove that target.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I knew that. In case of local environment does not have pypy so that it raises an error.

However, with your commend, I change the reason for remove pypy because there is no effect to review system. In fact, it reduces the jobs for Zuul.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

There is no zuul load: we don't run tests based on that environment in zuul."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:01:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'd like to hear the ideas from the others too. That environment was added long time ago, and I see it in other clients too. Maybe there was some effort to support it. I've found this discussion, and I'm not sure about the final outcome:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-May/117686.html"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:20:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Luigi here. I don't think this is a bug."}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:42:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

As I described again, it is a wishlist (https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-saharaclient/+bug/1756104)

Why we wanna keep if we don't use it for Zuul check?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I would investigate first what is the status of the pypy support in OpenStack. If it's not relevant anymore, we can discuss about removing it. Because another way of solving this could be adding a job, if this support could be useful."}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-18 09:15:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi everybody, any results yet?'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-19 08:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-03-19 13:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

If you go through the mailing list archives, you will see that support for pypy has oscillated over the years. As of now there is no requirement (from anybody, TC or otherwise) that we support pypy, but still some projects choose to support it (although note that, for example, Oslo projects which we depend on do not gate against pypy).

The gate can handle pypy if we so desire, see:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523609/
- http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs/tree/zuul.d/jobs.yaml#n349

There is an example of pypy support being added to a project ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523383/ ) although it was quickly removed ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524651/ )

I think we should give pypy an honest try, and add support for it in the Saharaclient gate. If it ends up unstable then we can kill it. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-19 16:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, give it a try then please give me feedback. I will let this patch here.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-03-20 21:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

On the other hand, most of our requirements don't have any kind of declaration of pypy support (the only one which gates against pypy is PBR... Babel and oslo.serialization have pypy in their tox.ini but do not test it in their respective CI systems)

So in that sense, trying to gate saharaclient against pypy will be a bit of a moving target as we have no way to predict whether or not out dependencies will spontaneously break when run on pypy (I didn't even check the support of stuff like test runners)"}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-26 12:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-16 11:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Recheck'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-16 11:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-16 13:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-16 13:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Topic bug/1756104 removed'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

please mention the change is also about something else (the removal of build_sphinx) and not just the testenv change. With a bit of summarizing both details can be part of the summary.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> please mention the change is also about something else (the removal
 > of build_sphinx) and not just the testenv change. With a bit of
 > summarizing both details can be part of the summary.

I already mentioned in commit message.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

But not in the summary.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-17 03:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-18 05:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-18 07:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-04-18 11:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Tox: cleanup usage of py34, remove a now-useless section

- Change testenv:debug34 to testenv:debug35
- Remove [build_sphinx] section in setup.cfg because
we does not need this anymore. See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ib2d866268e8cefe3b6db10184f43ee7caa957f13

glossary which can then be referenced where needed.

Add service account to daemonset in traefik

This allows traefik to access the resources protected
by Kubernetes RBAC

commit_message:
Enable proxy header parsing

Ensure that oslo.middleware parses any proxy information
forwarded from haproxy/apache with regards to protocol;
this ensures that https connections are correctly detected.

Change-Id: I64e8c14123e5d12850902ce99490697ca4bb853d
Closes-Bug: 1758675
(cherry picked from commit 50651ca6c08613b9861034ced6189a35430368bd)

commit_message:
Add fixture to limit unit test log output

This follows changes in Nova and Cinder to add a logging fixture that
allows the log level to be raised to limit the amount of junk output
in the unit test logs, while still processing debug level logs to
catch formatting error issues.

Change-Id: If740108db5291ff3fe0963127f9a3efadf3346c3

commit_message:
Remove v1 tests

In preparation to remove v1 API, lets clean out the v1 tests
so we can get clean view what else in our testing breaks when
we start removing the components.

Change-Id: I98aba2ce03a663c846bc6352a6ebe63d989aae0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 14:22:43.000000000', 'message': "Cleaning image data when image signature verification fails

While creating an image, image data stays in backend if image
signature verification fails.

After raising SignatureVerificationError exception, image status is
being set to 'killed' in DB but the image data remains as it is in
the backend.

Removing the _delete() method which is changing image status to 'killed',
and adding image.delete() call instead to cleanup the data. Also need to move
signature verification part after setting up the 'location' in image.location
since location is required to delete the data after failure.

Change-Id: I2a1a7addd33050cc8845aec24479aa4d1bc26ca0
Closes-Bug: #1736336
"}, {'created': '2017-12-20 07:04:54.000000000', 'message': "Cleaning image data when image signature verification fails

signature verification fails.

After raising SignatureVerificationError exception, image status is
being set to 'killed' in DB but the image data remains as it is in
the backend.

Adding image.delete() call in _delete() method to cleanup the data
from backend. Also moving signature verification part after setting
up the 'location' in image.location since location is required to delete
the data after failure.

Change-Id: I2a1a7addd33050cc8845aec24479aa4d1bc26ca0

signature verification fails.

After raising SignatureVerificationError exception, image status is
being set to 'killed' in DB but the image data remains as it is in

Adding delete_from_backend() call to cleanup the data from backend when

commit_message:
Cleaning image data when image signature verification fails

While creating an image, image data stays in backend if image
signature verification fails.

After raising SignatureVerificationError exception, image status is
being set to 'killed' in DB but the image data remains as it is in
the backend.

Adding delete_from_backend() call to cleanup the data from backend when
Singature Verification fails.

Currently mistral errors are masked in the cli with non helpful messages
like:

Closes-bug: #1754093

commit_message:
Do not let keystoneauth mask the errors

Currently mistral errors are masked in the cli with non helpful messages
like:
ERROR (app) Bad Request (HTTP 400)
by passing the raise_exc parameter as false to keystoneauth on the
session requests the errors are not masked and gives useful information
back to the cli like:
ERROR (app) Invalid input [name=std.echo, class=mistral.actions.std_actions.EchoAction, missing=['output']]

reference: https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/a516fdb1766115981dfb66b891648273026e04de/keystoneauth1/session.py#L573

Change-Id: I2573cb093e97ce378fc1d255d8b38e2ce818c8e5
Closes-bug: #1754093

'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 16:55:47.000000000', 'message': "Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed
"}, {'created': '2018-04-18 06:44:15.000000000', 'message': "Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: Add DB model

Adds the following items for BIOS Setting operations:

* bios_settings table
* database migration
* BIOSSetting object entry

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I48c96d5da0cb747b3ca3fceea9b4ffa85a9ebe22
Change-Id: Ia2c14c5674e34decaa075c2754e7a552bbb1beab
Story: #1712032

subject: Allow public network name to be changed

[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:56:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow public network name to be changed

This can be overridden in the defaults but hardcoded values prevent
the router being created, and floating IP pool being found

Change-Id: I57e4bfb5ab93971a757557e6a68475f2baceace2

commit_message:
Allow public network name to be changed

This can be overridden in the defaults but hardcoded values prevent
the router being created, and floating IP pool being found

Change-Id: I57e4bfb5ab93971a757557e6a68475f2baceace2

subject: Adding grub2 bootloader support to devstack plugin

commit_message:
Adding grub2 bootloader support to devstack plugin

This commit enables support for grub2 bootloader for UEFI.
It also enables UEFI Secure Boot based provisioning in devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I36a50656a52870121eda099f396523c46b7cb1aa

humm.., then I guess we don't change this, but the problem in panko client. Is that fine?

BTW, the problem that treating event_type, message_id, start_timestamp, end_timestamp as filters are really awkward since they are actually treated differently in the code. The operator is ignored and they aren't stored in the filters list but in a special object. So I think we still need to discuss a way to handle this mess I guess."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-09-13 12:57:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

sorry, i don't understand the confusion. from my pov, i think we should leave event_type and message_id alone. 'eq' is the only valid operator for those two i believe.

i believe your original issue was that start_timestamp and end_timestamp should only support 'eq' as well?"}, {'account_id': 26679, 'date': '2017-09-15 00:42:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@gordon Ok, I understand. That seems like a good idea for now. But I hope that you understand that treating these four fields like other traits should be considered to change. 

As you can see here (https://github.com/openstack/panko/blob/master/panko/api/controllers/v2/events.py#L219-L224), the operator is never stored and the value is specially stored in a different dict rather than the 'traits_filter'"}, {'account_id': 26679, 'date': '2017-09-15 00:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26679, 'date': '2017-09-15 01:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-15 03:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1
