we may want to support 'like' for event_type?"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-09-15 15:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

  /v2/events?start_timestamp=2017-08-28&event_type=instance

instead of

[{'created': '2017-08-31 03:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove operator checking when using filter

using openstack client. More details can be found in the following
links.

commit_message:
Operator for start/end_timestamp changes to 'eq'

start/end_timestamp originally are associated with op 'ge' and 'le'.
Changing them to 'eq' fixes the bug and the usage will make more sense.

Related review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/495763
Change-Id: Ia94a499f9340102553863db48dccb96bea92ea78
Closes-Bug: #1711997

[{'created': '2018-04-13 16:47:57.000000000', 'message': "Run jobs if requirements change

The dsvm jobs were not being run if only test-requirements.txt was
modified. However, devstack installs test-requirements so we should
run those jobs if that file changes.

The grenade multinode jobs were not being run if requirements.txt
was modified -- this was due to an extra '|' which caused it to be
considered an irrelevant file :-(

Change-Id: I1a49915ca52a93e77849dc5ead655656ad1bb34e
"}]
commit_message:
Run jobs if requirements change

The dsvm jobs were not being run if only test-requirements.txt was
modified. However, devstack installs test-requirements so we should
run those jobs if that file changes.

The grenade multinode jobs were not being run if requirements.txt
was modified -- this was due to an extra '|' which caused it to be
considered an irrelevant file :-(

Change-Id: I1a49915ca52a93e77849dc5ead655656ad1bb34e

commit_message:
Clean up driver_internal_info after tear_down

Raised long ago, was the fact that we should be
cleaning up driver_internal_info after tear down.
Long ago, it was conentious, but now it is fairly
strait forward as we already do some of the clean
up in the conductor.

Change-Id: Idab88e65794dc6ce4bfc4ec76d26123702600e94
Story: #1451885
Task: #9982

commit_message:
Enforce linear strategy for orchestrate-devstack

Document that orchestrate-devstack requires a linear strategy in the
invoking play. Also enforce the strategy in devstack.yaml.

Change-Id: Ia081225ec2be959fc5a4ddfd491f526296a8ca10

"Rocky".

Use the migrateToURI3() API instead of migrateToURI2() in test
test_live_migration_update_serial_console_xml.

Change-Id: I60311ee36eed8b4b1063f1ced0f0d0e30e880ca4
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
tests: unit: Fix 'test_live_migration_update_serial_console_xml'

This clean-up is part of the post libvirt / QEMU version bump in
"Rocky".

Use the migrateToURI3() API instead of migrateToURI2() in test
test_live_migration_update_serial_console_xml.

Change-Id: I60311ee36eed8b4b1063f1ced0f0d0e30e880ca4
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
specify required fields for projects

Specify that all entries in the projects list must have the repo and
hash set.

Change-Id: I9aed25d156a68f17c78945dbee9275ae636219e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 08:34:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multinode mode for devstack

Extend the devstack job so that it can support both single and multinode
cases.  Multinode mode require extra settings in devstack configuration,
some of which as subnode specific, some controller specific.

Also keep a simple devstack-multinode job defined for now so we can run
a multinode job in devstack gate, until the full tempest multinode job
is ready to match the old
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv.

Fixing multinode also requires sharing the CA configuration between
controller and peers, overlay network configuration for communication
between virtual machines and running discover_hosts for nova after the
subnode has been setup.

The extra orchestration required for multinode is encoded in a
dedicated role to allow for jobs in other repos to re-use it.

This backport is slightly modified from the original, since master does
not use the test-matrix anymore, while on stable branches we still rely
on it.

Change-Id: I2dcbd9bdb401860820e655d97aa3c4775af2827f
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 12:09:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multinode mode for devstack

subnode has been setup.

The extra orchestration required for multinode is encoded in a
dedicated role to allow for jobs in other repos to re-use it.

This backport is slightly modified from the original, since master does
not use the test-matrix anymore, while on stable branches we still rely
on it.

Change-Id: I2dcbd9bdb401860820e655d97aa3c4775af2827f

commit_message:
Fix multinode mode for devstack

Extend the devstack job so that it can support both single and multinode
cases.  Multinode mode require extra settings in devstack configuration,
some of which as subnode specific, some controller specific.

Also keep a simple devstack-multinode job defined for now so we can run
a multinode job in devstack gate, until the full tempest multinode job
is ready to match the old
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv.

Fixing multinode also requires sharing the CA configuration between
controller and peers, overlay network configuration for communication
between virtual machines and running discover_hosts for nova after the
subnode has been setup.

The extra orchestration required for multinode is encoded in a
dedicated role to allow for jobs in other repos to re-use it.

This backport is slightly modified from the original, since master does
not use the test-matrix anymore, while on stable branches we still rely
on it.

Change-Id: I2dcbd9bdb401860820e655d97aa3c4775af2827f

commit_message:
Optimizing big 'on-XXX' clauses

* Fixed the implementation of data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context
  method so that it doesn't use copy.deepcopy() because it may be
  very expensive (both CPU and RAM) on big dictionaries.

Change-Id: I6cc77c6ded1e8f00ff164156be9312e1ccb86efb
(cherry picked from commit 4936d778e5ad1eebfd54c86f9daa249fb2ee8ab5)

Talking with Dan about this.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-01 17:05:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Talking with Dan, the point of getting 'accepted' migrations to remove them when the source compute starts back up is to avoid a race where the instance is evacuating to a dest host and we don't want it living in two places at the same time. And we intentionally don't compare instance.host to self.host as that is an old issue if the hostname changes on the compute and we'd just delete all of your instances (apparently a common problem when using vsphere), but that also predates the usage of migration records for evacuations and filtering instances using the migration records here.

So if there is no point in having the guest on the source host, then this is actually working as designed, by deleting the guest. The instance.host would still point at the source host, and the resource tracker will track the instance that way, but if all computes are upgraded the RT won't recreate the allocations for the source host.

Dan also pointed out that if the source host comes back up, you could rebuild the instance on it to fix the deleted guest issue. And we could signal this by setting the instance to ERROR state in conductor if evacuate fails to find another host (and you can rebuild an instance in ERROR state).

So maybe the fix here is just setting the instance to ERROR state if the evacuate fails in conductor and let the source compute cleanup as it's doing."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-01 18:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/499237/3/ : FAILURE in 51m 12s'}, {'account_id': 21784, 'date': '2017-09-02 09:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

intel-nfv-ci recheck'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-04 09:42:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> Talking with Dan, the point of getting 'accepted' migrations to
 > remove them when the source compute starts back up is to avoid a
 > race where the instance is evacuating to a dest host and we don't
 > want it living in two places at the same time. And we intentionally

Evacuate is an admin action. I think the admin is expected to fence the host before start the evacuation and only remove the fence after the evacuation is finished (or she gave up on evacuation the instance). So we might not need to add complexity to nova to avoid this race.

 > don't compare instance.host to self.host as that is an old issue if
 > the hostname changes on the compute and we'd just delete all of
 > your instances (apparently a common problem when using vsphere),
 > but that also predates the usage of migration records for
 > evacuations and filtering instances using the migration records
 > here.
 > 
 > So if there is no point in having the guest on the source host,
 > then this is actually working as designed, by deleting the guest.
 > The instance.host would still point at the source host, and the
 > resource tracker will track the instance that way, but if all
 > computes are upgraded the RT won't recreate the allocations for the
 > source host.

The current design tries to delete the instance but it fails to delete the instance allocations in placement http://paste.openstack.org/show/620306/. If we agree that deleting is the expected behavior then I guess we need a separate bug for the placement failure.

 > 
 > Dan also pointed out that if the source host comes back up, you
 > could rebuild the instance on it to fix the deleted guest issue.
 > And we could signal this by setting the instance to ERROR state in
 > conductor if evacuate fails to find another host (and you can
 > rebuild an instance in ERROR state).
 > 
 > So maybe the fix here is just setting the instance to ERROR state
 > if the evacuate fails in conductor and let the source compute
 > cleanup as it's doing.

So the fix for this bug #1713783 would be to keep the deleting behavior in the source compute but set the instance to ERROR state during the failed evacuation. What to do with the instance resource allocations on the source host. Do we try to delete it during the source compute host recovery or not?
If we want to delete such allocation then we need to fix a placement failure first, visible in http://paste.openstack.org/show/620306/. 
Will the rebuild on the recovered host re-allocate the resources of the instance? 

We at least need to add a functional test case for the recovery + rebuild case."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-04 10:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I opened the bug #1714924 to track the solution for the stack trace I linked above.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-06 14:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Added a item to the ptg etherpad to cover the open questions https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-queens'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-06 14:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A similar case is also proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499877'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-06 17:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Will the rebuild on the recovered host re-allocate the resources of the instance?

I don't think so, no. During a rebuild (not evacuate), we make no claim on the original source node, because we made that claim when we originally created the instance there. So conductor also bypasses the scheduler during a rebuild operation. And since the ResourceTracker isn't going to "heal" the allocation for the node (once all computes are running Pike code), then the allocation is gone for the source node if the evacuate removed it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-06 17:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> A similar case is also proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499877

That change is different. That's just adding a test to show how something is working today when we've made the claim on the dest compute but the rebuild fails in the virt driver, it's showing that the MoveClaim is aborted and the ResourceTracker removes the destination node allocation automatically. In that case, the migration is also set to 'failed' status here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6dd6eddd46740622b1a2f10391b147526b9fcb35/nova/compute/manager.py#L2813

So _destroy_evacuated_instances on the source node won't touch it."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-07 07:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > A similar case is also proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499877
 > 
 > That change is different. That's just adding a test to show how
 > something is working today when we've made the claim on the dest
 > compute but the rebuild fails in the virt driver, it's showing that
 > the MoveClaim is aborted and the ResourceTracker removes the
 > destination node allocation automatically. In that case, the
 > migration is also set to 'failed' status here:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6dd6eddd46740622b1a2f10391b147526b9fcb35/nova/compute/manager.py#L2813
 > 
 > So _destroy_evacuated_instances on the source node won't touch it.

To keep the rebuild code path simpler I suggest to keep the expected behavior the same after a failed evacuation regardless of the reason of the failure (NoValidHost or failed claim on the dest host)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-07 14:25:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> To keep the rebuild code path simpler I suggest to keep the expected behavior the same after a failed evacuation regardless of the reason of the failure (NoValidHost or failed claim on the dest host).

I tend to agree with you, especially after you pointed out that even if we rebuild the instance on the source node (after _destroy_evacuated_instances deletes the guest and the source node allocation), that the rebuild isn't going to re-create the allocation on the source node since it's a rebuild and we don't do another claim in that case.

However, didn't you point out that we fail to remove the allocation here anyway if we failed to evacuate the instance because it sends an empty allocation resources dict? Still, I don't really like the idea of relying on the operator bringing the source host back up and then rebuilding the instance there, plus if/when we fix the bug with removing the source node allocation properly, a rebuild won't replace that allocation unless we add code for that, which I don't want to do."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-09-07 14:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

We agreed with Matt on IRC to put the migration to failed and to prevent deleting the source node allocation.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-07 14:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

+1 after discussing this more with gibi, I think we're on the same page now and agree with this fix, but just +1 until we can discuss with Dan at the PTG:

(9:30:05 AM) mriedem: gibi: i tend to agree with your point that we should handle a failure in the conductor (NoValidHost) the same as it's being handled in the compute when a claim fails or the spawn fails on the dest node,
(9:30:08 AM) gibi: mriedem: I agree that rebuild after failed evac is not a major use case but I know about users depending on it. So I don't really want to prevent it
(9:30:16 AM) mriedem: which is set the migration status to a state such that _destroy_evacuated_instances on the source node doesn't process it,
(9:30:19 AM) mriedem: and delete the dest node allocation
(9:31:07 AM) gibi: mriedem: OK. then I think we can set the migration to failed, and then nova will not try to delete source allocation either after the source compute is brought up
(9:31:08 AM) mriedem: gibi: given that rebuild does not allocate resources or make a claim, i think in that case it's actually preferrable to *not* attempt to delete the source node allocations if the evacuate failed,
(9:31:20 AM) gibi: mriedem: totally agree
(9:31:22 AM) mriedem: because if the evac fails and you want to rebuild the instance on the source node after it comes back up, then the allocations are still there
(9:31:41 AM) gibi: I think that we are on the same page now :)
(9:31:53 AM) mriedem: and if the evac fails on the dest node, regardless of location (conductor or compute), we put the migration status into a state such that the source node won't process it
(9:31:57 AM) mriedem: when it's restarted
(9:32:11 AM) gibi: mriedem: agreee"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-12 22:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-15 21:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-15 21:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

We agreed at the Queens PTG to fix the bug this way so it's consistent with failed evacuations on the destination node (migration is set to 'failed'), and we don't want to change rebuild to need to know if it should create a new allocation. Plus we assume operators are fencing the source compute and won't restart it unless all instances are deleted or evacuated."}, {'account_id': 23310, 'date': '2017-09-16 04:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-09-16 06:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Set error state after failed evacuation

When evacuation fails with NoValidHost, the migration status remains
'accepted' instead of 'error'. This causes problem in case the compute
service starts up again and looks for evacuations with status 'accepted',
as it then removes the local instances for those evacuations even though
the instance was never actually evacuated to another host.

Change-Id: I06d78c744fa75ae5f34c5cfa76bc3c9460767b84
Closes-Bug: #1713783

commit_message:
Revert temporary patch that disables linter errors locally

A previous patch [1] added local disables for linter errors caused by a
bug in astroid 1.6.2 [2] that was fixed.

This patch reverts the local disables of pylint and updates the
test-requirements file to reflect the needed version.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/554832
[2]: https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1965

Change-Id: I3c19979498a1c7c389993e2f3d7e12089e08e14f

'}]
commit_message:
tests: unit: Fix 'test_live_migration_update_graphics_xml'

This clean-up is part of the post libvirt / QEMU version bump in
"Rocky".

Two main changes:

  - Use the migrateToURI3() API instead of migrateToURI2().

  - Replace the usage of Mox with Mock.  (I know we should try to stick
    to the sensible rule of "one logical change per patch".  But the
    test was already failing and we're systematically removing the usage
    of Mox in the source anyway.  I thought this was a reasonable
    reasonable scenario.)

Change-Id: If26ffdd73b87b2c5334b7d8d12ec6f00160de067
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-13 17:14:13.000000000', 'message': "containerized/undercloud: don't prepare containers by default

By default, we don't need to prepare the containers anymore, since they
are now prepared in tripleoclient since:
I00f72b1cd7ab6a03dd42bc489f3c950ee32dedeb

We also introduce update_containers boolean that will be use in the near

commit_message:
containerized/undercloud: don't prepare containers by default

By default, we don't need to prepare the containers anymore, since they
are now prepared in tripleoclient since:
I00f72b1cd7ab6a03dd42bc489f3c950ee32dedeb

We also introduce update_containers boolean that will be use in the near
future, so we will prepare containers, update them and use them to
deploy the undercloud and overcloud. This will be pushed later though.

Change-Id: I5b76f80cfa4066845c0ec4c9e765d57d9ec2bfc9

commit_message:
Replace insecure function eval

In neutronclient we use a eval function for processing
CLI neutron arguments. This function possible insecure because
eval get argument from client side. Instead of it we can use
a dict with allowed types which is more secure.
This bug related to Bandit issues.
This patch was already merged in upstream master branch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555301/8/

Change-Id: Ib65f1caffefd8ac6a1debd3527ad32cf88b157c6
Related-Prod: PROD-19413

commit_message:
Add MicroversionMixin for microversion support

This generic mixin overloads plugin client() method to return
a client with max microversion unless a specific version is requested.

This provides two abstract methods
- get_max_microversion()
- is_version_supported()

for client plugins to override when supporting microversions.

Change-Id: I8873ab6d815671b6647b08578d1406dd874269f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid race in OSWaitCondition test

While sending a signal to a WaitCondition is synchronous, the actual update
of the WaitConditionHandle metadata happens asynchronously since the fix
for bug 1394095. As a result, it's not guaranteed that even the first 6
signals (which are sent in serially, as opposed to the later ones which are
deliberately sent in parallel) will be stored in the same order that they
are sent.

Crucially, that means that one or more of the signals explicitly sent with
id 5 may arrive when there have been only three previous signals stored.
This means that the next signal to arrive with an implicit ID will be the
fifth signal stored, and therefore also get id 5. Of course we have a log
message to indicate when an existing signal is overwritten by another with
the same ID, and we are not seeing it except in the intended case where we
explicitly send in the same ID twice. That's because the keys have
different types in the data dict - the explicitly specified ID is the
string "5", but the implicitly calculated one is the integer 5. But - get
this - when we serialise the data to JSON both keys are serialised to the
string "5", and upon deserialisation they collide and one is silently
dropped on the floor.

So if the signal with the explicit ID "5" is stored just before the one
with reason "signal 4", then "signal 4" will effectively be silently
ignored as the 5th signal to arrive - a slot already filled. And since that
signal is ignored, the next signal will also be treated as the 5th to
arrive and ignored, and so on. This leads inexorably to the dreaded
"WaitConditionTimeout: resources.wait_condition: 4 of 25 received" error.

For this reason, it's a bad idea to mix explicit IDs that are also integers
with implicitly assigned IDs. Use an ID that won't collide instead.

This patch is backported from
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat-tempest-plugin/commit/?id=2cff12bceb4b568cd8673c9ffa5668d37fcc9da9

Change-Id: Ie2608285ba9c0ec3f1e4a8bbf1a147ce35ccae00
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550682
Closes-Bug: #1738653
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid race in OSWaitCondition test

While sending a signal to a WaitCondition is synchronous, the actual update
of the WaitConditionHandle metadata happens asynchronously since the fix
for bug 1394095. As a result, it's not guaranteed that even the first 6
signals (which are sent in serially, as opposed to the later ones which are
deliberately sent in parallel) will be stored in the same order that they
are sent.

Crucially, that means that one or more of the signals explicitly sent with
id 5 may arrive when there have been only three previous signals stored.
This means that the next signal to arrive with an implicit ID will be the
fifth signal stored, and therefore also get id 5. Of course we have a log
message to indicate when an existing signal is overwritten by another with
the same ID, and we are not seeing it except in the intended case where we
explicitly send in the same ID twice. That's because the keys have
different types in the data dict - the explicitly specified ID is the
string "5", but the implicitly calculated one is the integer 5. But - get
this - when we serialise the data to JSON both keys are serialised to the
string "5", and upon deserialisation they collide and one is silently
dropped on the floor.

So if the signal with the explicit ID "5" is stored just before the one
with reason "signal 4", then "signal 4" will effectively be silently
ignored as the 5th signal to arrive - a slot already filled. And since that
signal is ignored, the next signal will also be treated as the 5th to
arrive and ignored, and so on. This leads inexorably to the dreaded
"WaitConditionTimeout: resources.wait_condition: 4 of 25 received" error.

For this reason, it's a bad idea to mix explicit IDs that are also integers
with implicitly assigned IDs. Use an ID that won't collide instead.

This patch is backported from
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat-tempest-plugin/commit/?id=2cff12bceb4b568cd8673c9ffa5668d37fcc9da9

Change-Id: Ie2608285ba9c0ec3f1e4a8bbf1a147ce35ccae00
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550682
Closes-Bug: #1738653

messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-04-16 10:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 14:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add .testr.conf to work with latest Tempest

The .testr.conf file has been removed from the tempest tree, because the
tempest command has been switched to stestr in the latest version (and
tempest is branchless, so devstack clones the latest version). However the
Ocata test environment actually has an old version of tempest installed
that uses testr. Create a .testr.conf file so that we can run tempest.

This change is adapted from f77fab1c09a8fddef983980bf6553090b0f047f0 in
the Pike branch, which encountered the same issue in its grenade tests
(since grenade starts by installing the previous version).

Change-Id: I0328e3c7229f893f78fa8c3590c5160093f1bc18
'}]
commit_message:
Add .testr.conf to work with latest Tempest

The .testr.conf file has been removed from the tempest tree, because the
tempest command has been switched to stestr in the latest version (and
tempest is branchless, so devstack clones the latest version). However the
Ocata test environment actually has an old version of tempest installed
that uses testr. Create a .testr.conf file so that we can run tempest.

This change is adapted from f77fab1c09a8fddef983980bf6553090b0f047f0 in
the Pike branch, which encountered the same issue in its grenade tests
(since grenade starts by installing the previous version).

Change-Id: I0328e3c7229f893f78fa8c3590c5160093f1bc18

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 15:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe ML2: reuse network VNI

Since Queens, bagpipe ML2 uses the vxlan type driver and hence ought
to use as a VXLAN ID the VNI allocated by neutron.

However the current code does not pass the VNI from the bagpipe ML2
agent extension to bagpipe-bgp, which results in:
- allocating a different/new VXLAN VNI
- creating a new vxlan interface on the bridge (with linuxbridge)
  rather than reusing the interface created by the Neutron agent,
  resulting in dataplane loops

With this change the VNI is correctly passed to bagpipe-bgp (which
allows bagpipe-bgp to reuse the existing VXLAN interface).

Change-Id: I11c8bfa70a048dbf8a8cf0dffef302f7efd98771
Closes-Bug: 1756361
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 13:14:45.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe ML2: reuse network VNI

commit_message:
bagpipe ML2: reuse network VNI

Since Queens, bagpipe ML2 uses the vxlan type driver and hence ought
to use as a VXLAN ID the VNI allocated by neutron.

However the current code does not pass the VNI from the bagpipe ML2
agent extension to bagpipe-bgp, which results in:
- allocating a different/new VXLAN VNI
- creating a new vxlan interface on the bridge (with linuxbridge)
  rather than reusing the interface created by the Neutron agent,
  resulting in dataplane loops

With this change the VNI is correctly passed to bagpipe-bgp (which
allows bagpipe-bgp to reuse the existing VXLAN interface).

Change-Id: I11c8bfa70a048dbf8a8cf0dffef302f7efd98771
Closes-Bug: 1756361

With this change, the agent extension for bagpipe ML2 will:
- silently skip non-existing ports (bug 1764421)
- avoid calling attach_port after detach_port on a deleted port
  (bug 1764102: the agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling
   do_port_plug_refresh before having removed the port from
   internal datastructure, hence causing the detach_port to be
   followed by a bogus attach_port.
- plug/unplug ports according to admin_status_up

commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: properly handle deleted/down/non-existing ports

With this change, the agent extension for bagpipe ML2 will:
- silently skip non-existing ports (bug 1764421)
- avoid calling attach_port after detach_port on a deleted port
  (bug 1764102: the agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling
   do_port_plug_refresh before having removed the port from
   internal datastructure, hence causing the detach_port to be
   followed by a bogus attach_port.
- plug/unplug ports according to admin_status_up

Partial-Bug: 1764421
Closes-Bug: 1764702
Change-Id: If26464e889fec94e344f6cb0865274ec22929e80

commit_message:
Displays container specific information in freezer

When user passes container name while performing info
action, only container specific information will be shown

Change-Id: I38fc19ed931cd0e952e0ede57afca4afdaee78df
Closes-Bug: #1684026

there is no difference , in storage layer , you also must set a limit and get the MAX limit page over and over again, IMHO'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Published edit on patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 22484, 'date': '2018-01-23 01:01:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> @gengchc2, I mean in storage layer we may get the all the queues in
 > one time and then do the filter.  No need to get the MAX limit page
 > over and over again in transport layer.

If we only get all queue, we can do it in API level or storage layer: for example, in storage, we can query all queues without limit, and in API, we force to set limit to the max number that zaqar can support, so that it can also be found out.
But it's not good to query all queues at once, for example, there are 10000 queues, and the filter meets the requirements, and each time takes 20 queues.The whole query process is as follows:
1. query 10000 queues and take 20 queues to return to the client
2. query the 9980 queue and take 20 queues to return to the client
3. query the 9960 queue and take 20 queues to return to the client
...
This efficiency is too low. I think that it is better to query limit queues at server by one query or mulitple querys . If the number of querying databases is too many, you can customize a value without page value, such as page x 10 or configure a value."}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2018-01-23 01:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Published edit on patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 14203, 'date': '2018-01-24 01:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Support query filter in queue.

name and metadata in mongodb backend.

Other backends will support in following patchs.

commit_message:
SUSE: Add missing Ceph packages and drop the python3 ones

python-rbd and python-rgw are also required to complete the list of all
python bindings for Ceph. Moreover, openSUSE is using python2 by default
so we don't need to pull any python3-* packages (and all the python3
dependencies) for no reason.

Change-Id: Idda06486fa6ba30378c4e632ff50b5baa577caf9

commit_message:
Move misplaced objects when no active shard ranges

When all shard ranges have shrunk away, ensure that any misplaced
objects get a destination which is the root container.

Drive-by: change container server GET handler to accept a 'states'
param rather than 'state' to be consistent with the broker
get_shard_ranges method.

Change-Id: I62b0827f1412fefab89baa052dde63fba2a59a03

subject: Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-12 17:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-12 22:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

So if we've got a cache hit that says a container is alive and sharded, but on the container server it's deleted, what happens when a client requests a listing? I guess the result probably depends on whether the shards are marked deleted?"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-13 13:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-13 13:15:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

I also realised the concern about proxy gets...We don't currently check the info cache* for sharding state, but neverthess I've made the delete override more explicit.

* AFAICT there isn't a way of checking for cached info without kicking off a HEAD if there is no cached info."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-16 19:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-18 07:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 17:27:03.000000000', 'message': 'Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container

Shards still need to be able to fetch shard ranges for audit after a
container has been deleted. The concept of deleted should only apply
to object requests.

Also, return x-backend-record-type header with container GET
responses, and check it in sharder _fetch_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I6e01f110e8ff9900a8ed4ea39b7d643e1d5c99a9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-13 13:10:45.000000000', 'message': 'Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container

Shards still need to be able to fetch shard ranges for audit after a
container has been deleted. This patch adds support for a new
X-Backend-Delete-Override header which if present will cause a
container GET request for shard record types to ignore the deleted
status of the container, unless the container db has been deleted.

Also, return x-backend-record-type header with container GET
responses, and check it is present when shard ranges are
fetched.

Change-Id: I6e01f110e8ff9900a8ed4ea39b7d643e1d5c99a9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 16:31:01.000000000', 'message': 'Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container

...and also for deleted shard ranges to be fetched.

Shards still need to be able to fetch shard ranges for audit after a
container has been deleted. This patch adds support for a new
X-Backend-Override-Deleted header which if present will cause a
container GET request for shard record types to ignore the deleted
status of the container, unless the container db has been deleted.

To enable deleted shard ranged to be fetched a new
X-Backend-Include-Deleted header is introduced which when present in a
container GET request for shard record types will cause deleted shard
ranges to be included.

Also, return x-backend-record-type header with container GET
responses, and check it is present when shard ranges are
fetched.

Change-Id: I6e01f110e8ff9900a8ed4ea39b7d643e1d5c99a9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 19:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container

...and also for deleted shard ranges to be fetched.

Shards still need to be able to fetch shard ranges for audit after a
container has been deleted. This patch adds support for a new
X-Backend-Override-Deleted header which if present will cause a
container GET request for shard record types to ignore the deleted
status of the container, unless the container db has been deleted.

To enable deleted shard ranged to be fetched a new
X-Backend-Include-Deleted header is introduced which when present in a
container GET request for shard record types will cause deleted shard
ranges to be included.

Also, return x-backend-record-type header with container GET
responses, and check it is present when shard ranges are
fetched.

Change-Id: I6e01f110e8ff9900a8ed4ea39b7d643e1d5c99a9
'}]
commit_message:
Enable shard ranges to be fetched from a deleted container

...and also for deleted shard ranges to be fetched.

Shards still need to be able to fetch shard ranges for audit after a
container has been deleted. This patch adds support for a new
X-Backend-Override-Deleted header which if present will cause a
container GET request for shard record types to ignore the deleted
status of the container, unless the container db has been deleted.

To enable deleted shard ranged to be fetched a new
X-Backend-Include-Deleted header is introduced which when present in a
container GET request for shard record types will cause deleted shard
ranges to be included.

Also, return x-backend-record-type header with container GET
responses, and check it is present when shard ranges are
fetched.

Change-Id: I6e01f110e8ff9900a8ed4ea39b7d643e1d5c99a9

commit_message:
Function versioning API: create

This patch supports to create function version.

- Versioning feature is only allowed for package type function for now
- New version creation code should be wrapped in lock to avoid any
  race condition
- New version number is calculated by Qinling and no need to be
  provided by end users
- Version creation is not allowed if no change happened to function
  package.
- Only function owner can create version.
- Maximum version number is 10 by default, we will make it configurable
  as needed in future.
- All function versions will be deleted when function itself is deleted

This patch only focuses on version creation, the other version
operations and related function operations will be handled in the
following patches.

Story: #2001829
Task: #14305
Change-Id: I62bb344da237766fc11cce2ffda65945313136b1

commit_message:
Apply UC to Dockerfiles

Upper constraints weren't applied to the Dockerfiles installation so
pip install deps when over it. This commit fixes it by defining a new
env var for it and passit it to pip.

Closes-Bug: #1763752
Change-Id: Id126fee033db6f150ad95c94682eb56b4b2cea03

[{'created': '2018-04-13 15:00:04.000000000', 'message': "Execute kuryr-cni as `docker exec`

This commit changes the way kuryr-cni is executed in containerized
deployments. Now it'll use `docker exec` command to execute kuryr-cni
inside the CNI container. This should make it easier to be consumed by
deployers.

To be able to do such changes I needed to stop mounting host's /etc
directory. I believe this was unnecessary and was blocking curl from
working in isolation from host OS.

Closes-Bug: 1757531

commit_message:
Execute kuryr-cni as `docker exec`

This commit changes the way kuryr-cni is executed in containerized
deployments. Now it'll use `docker exec` command to execute kuryr-cni
inside the CNI container. This should make it easier to be consumed by
deployers.

To be able to do such changes I needed to stop mounting host's /etc
directory. I believe this was unnecessary and was blocking curl from
working in isolation from host OS.

Closes-Bug: 1757531

Change-Id: I373d65536a43eab98f0fc708936b97637f82eaff
(cherry picked from commit 206c158d37060142d7d80d1be0564be10af576e7)

commit_message:
Remove firewall (v1) shared attribute from tests

The V1 firewall object does not support 'shared' attribute.
This patch removes this attribute from the unit tests, and delete
the already skipped test test_update_firewall_shared_fails_for_non_admin
which is irrelevant.

Change-Id: Ib9091bba9a8a3f5c04562304477c20506b2c91dc
Closes-Bug: #1622694

commit_message:
Suppress resize error on resizing browser

This bug seems to be due to rare situation, so we could not identify
the reason for now.
But this bug occurred when cloud-shell.controller is missing container ID.
If this bug occur, the toast popups so many and they are so obstacle.
So this patch changes cloud-shell.controller to ignure the resize event
when container ID was missing.

Change-Id: I598c11c9fb2086e7e001b70df8de57968d6d13db
Closes-Bug: #1764953

commit_message:
Add bionic support

This change is mostly a port of the change authored by mthaddon
to add bionic support to the charm.

As noted in the readme postgres 10 is currently not supported so the
corresponding functional test uses a xenial postgresql node.

Change-Id: I3f11f024ced8aa5ae58135d5e5e23ed94d4c31f9

commit_message:
Suppress resize error on resizing browser

This bug seems to be due to rare situation, so we could not identify
the reason for now.
But this bug occurred when cloud-shell.controller is missing container ID.
If this bug occur, the toast popups so many and they are so obstacle.
So this patch changes cloud-shell.controller to ignure the resize event
when container ID was missing.

Change-Id: I598c11c9fb2086e7e001b70df8de57968d6d13db
Closes-Bug: #1764953

[{'created': '2018-04-17 10:32:59.000000000', 'message': "Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

Currently haproxy for swift doesn't have default setting. This generates config
such as

  listen swift_proxy_server
  bind 10.0.0.5:13808 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.16.1.4:8080 transparent
  option httpchk GET /healthcheck
  timeout client 2m
  timeout server 2m
  server overcloud-controller-0.storage.localdomain 172.16.1.10:8080 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

without

  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option httplog

This makes really hard to debug in case of issues.

This patch merges default_listen_options with swift to have config which is
more reliable for debugging

Change-Id: I6716499b4a10f3ba39db33d6468c261c58ee373d
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 12:51:16.000000000', 'message': "Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

commit_message:
Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

Currently haproxy for swift doesn't have default setting. This generates config
such as

  listen swift_proxy_server
  bind 10.0.0.5:13808 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.16.1.4:8080 transparent
  option httpchk GET /healthcheck
  timeout client 2m
  timeout server 2m
  server overcloud-controller-0.storage.localdomain 172.16.1.10:8080 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

without

  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option httplog

This makes really hard to debug in case of issues.

This patch merges default_listen_options with swift to have config which is
more reliable for debugging

Closes-Bug: #1764731
Change-Id: I6716499b4a10f3ba39db33d6468c261c58ee373d

[{'created': '2018-03-27 00:05:01.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require the bootstrap password to come in via arguments

Currently when this is being ran, and say ara is being used to
capture the running of kolla-ansible ara will capture the full
command line ran (even if no_log is set); because by default these
modules do not hide what they are running.

So to avoid the situation where the command line shows the password
have this also be able to take in the password via an environment
variable as well (which ara will not capture).

Change-Id: I4d42d592d8031d0f3923bccc6b2db1149af08e75
'}]
commit_message:
Do not require the bootstrap password to come in via arguments

Currently when this is being ran, and say ara is being used to
capture the running of kolla-ansible ara will capture the full
command line ran (even if no_log is set); because by default these
modules do not hide what they are running.

So to avoid the situation where the command line shows the password
have this also be able to take in the password via an environment
variable as well (which ara will not capture).

Change-Id: I4d42d592d8031d0f3923bccc6b2db1149af08e75

In a spirit similar to stub_out, stub_object does mock patching, but on
an object.

This is in response to many of the patches in this group:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/mox-removal

...which replaced object-like mox's with stub_out, which usually works,
but isn't the same thing.

Change-Id: Ifdd04a1c317700dc7401acccfa0724a9108b15c2
"}]
commit_message:
test.stub_object

In a spirit similar to stub_out, stub_object does mock patching, but on
an object.

This is in response to many of the patches in this group:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/mox-removal

...which replaced object-like mox's with stub_out, which usually works,
but isn't the same thing.

Change-Id: Ifdd04a1c317700dc7401acccfa0724a9108b15c2

commit_message:
Fix path to local cirros image for pingtest

The path to the cached cirros image changed from
/opt/stack/cache/files/ to /opt/cache/files/ during the zuulv3
migration.

Change-Id: Id153a7b6b540436d8df1d1d19e650d0b958b4a4d

subject: Remove unnecessary apostrophe
messages:
[{'account_id': 28060, 'date': '2018-04-03 21:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-03 21:18:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Use the loop device in fstab instead of image file

When adding an fstab entry for a loopback device use the explicit
loopback device name rather than the source image file. This prevents
a new loopback device being created implitcitly when mounting the
image.

The unit tests needed updating to reflect that the loopback
device name is used when creating mountpoint names rather than than
the name of the image file. This was pre-existing behaviour.

Change-Id: Ide074310bf7121f1179e0b5237dff6f3da88e24e
Closes-Bug: #1762390

commit_message:
Work around version check bug in poise-python

There is a broken version check that triggers on pip version 10, see
[1]. Pin pip to version 9.0.3 as a workaround for now.

[1] https://github.com/poise/poise-python/issues/107

Change-Id: I30caa26470501cfd942fb2b85f490381af9c0ce4

commit_message:
Add formatting param for disk usage

Pass formatting option to ceph for easier postprocessing.
Constrain to values accepted by ceph, default to plain format.

Change-Id: I0bb8cfcd8d8962988e786d2d083b1489161b2ff6
Closes-Bug: #1724880

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 07:22:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock

An OVN Worker handles the create/update notifications only if it has acquired
the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock'. by checking 'idl.is_lock_contended' to
true. 'idl.is_lock_contended' is expected to be true if the ovn worker has
requested for the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' from the ovsdb-server and
acquired it. Looks like there is a bug in python ovs idl code because of
which 'idl.is_lock_contended' is set to true even if it doesn't have the lock.

This issue should be fixed in python ovs idl. But it is better to be explicit
in networking-ovn. So this patch fixes the issue by inversing the logic in the
OvnIdl.notify() function by handling the event only if 'idl.lock_name and
idl.has_lock' is true.

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I35c6514f79065c2227c1ffeeb08532c4858055d2
"}, {'created': '2018-04-11 08:32:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock

the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock'. by checking 'idl.is_lock_contended' to
true. 'idl.is_lock_contended' is expected to be true if the ovn worker has
requested for the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' from the ovsdb-server and
acquired it. Looks like there is a bug in python ovs idl code because of
which 'idl.is_lock_contended' is set to true even if it doesn't have the lock.

This issue should be fixed in python ovs idl. But it is better to be explicit
in networking-ovn. So this patch fixes the issue by inversing the logic in the
OvnIdl.notify() function by handling the event only if 'idl.lock_name and
idl.has_lock' is true.

This patch also fixes the 'has_lock' check in maintenance thread.

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I35c6514f79065c2227c1ffeeb08532c4858055d2

commit_message:
Fix OVSDB Error seen during startup if OVN worker doesn't have lock

An OVN Worker handles the create/update notifications only if it has acquired
the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' by checking 'idl.is_lock_contended' to
true. 'idl.is_lock_contended' is expected to be true if the ovn worker has
requested for the lock 'neutron_ovn_event_lock' from the ovsdb-server and
acquired it. Looks like there is a bug in python ovs idl code because of
which 'idl.is_lock_contended' is set to true even if it doesn't have the lock.

This issue should be fixed in python ovs idl. But it is better to be explicit
in networking-ovn. So this patch fixes the issue by inversing the logic in the
OvnIdl.notify() function by handling the event only if 'idl.lock_name and
idl.has_lock' is true.

This patch also fixes the 'has_lock' check in maintenance thread.

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I35c6514f79065c2227c1ffeeb08532c4858055d2

[{'created': '2018-04-18 06:14:56.000000000', 'message': 'Suppress conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option

This patch fixes conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option.
To suppress this conflicts, when retry option selected this patch clears
auto_remove option and set readonly attribute for the checkbox.

Also, to check them easily from user, move auto_remove option from
Miscellaneous tab to Spec tab, i.e. under retry options.

Change-Id: I34a409141adf1ad822e5999240ccbb8ae8e2acf5
Closes-Bug: #1763250
(cherry picked from commit 1d47c368fe4ef5f8ef360296dd1ed4fc149f0b7e)
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option

This patch fixes conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option.
To suppress this conflicts, when retry option selected this patch clears
auto_remove option and set readonly attribute for the checkbox.

Also, to check them easily from user, move auto_remove option from
Miscellaneous tab to Spec tab, i.e. under retry options.

Change-Id: I34a409141adf1ad822e5999240ccbb8ae8e2acf5
Closes-Bug: #1763250
(cherry picked from commit 1d47c368fe4ef5f8ef360296dd1ed4fc149f0b7e)

[{'created': '2018-02-06 07:35:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586

commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586

to minimize the scope of the lock that prevents multiple entries in the

commit_message:
Reduce scope of the lock for image volume cache

Refactor the code that creates a volume from a downloaded glance image
to minimize the scope of the lock that prevents multiple entries in the
volume image cache. Now the lock serializes only the portion of the
code that causes the cache entry to be created. Locking is minimized
when the volume is already cached, or when the volume won't be cached.

Closes-Bug: #1758414
Change-Id: I547fb4bcdd4783225b8ca96d157c61ca3bcf4ef4
(cherry picked from commit a351cd01c0bf937e82efc3e1256da479be24cfcf)
(cherry picked from commit bc05efc79aaedd06308f7f173df09fd6a23aa2b3)

commit_message:
Prevent duplicate entries in the image cache

Add a synchronization lock to prevent duplicate entries in the image
cache. The relevant code was refactored into its own function in order
to reduce the scope of the lock.

Closes-Bug: #1649636
Change-Id: I979f966c821876750b2a616ef32a905192eafbd6
(cherry picked from commit 63aa3c7d1cf73e18067a7ae3a68a173359994aab)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.20

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I83235b2051ab4ebd24f79ff5f91575dc6f16b7c0
Change-Id: Id2ab1c4b53def85f156daa5d1b7ef986e26924b8

commit_message:
Suppress conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option

This patch fixes conflicts between retry options and auto_remove option.
To suppress this conflicts, when retry option selected this patch clears
auto_remove option and set readonly attribute for the checkbox.

Also, to check them easily from user, move auto_remove option from
Miscellaneous tab to Spec tab, i.e. under retry options.

Change-Id: I34a409141adf1ad822e5999240ccbb8ae8e2acf5
Closes-Bug: #1763250

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15
(cherry picked from commit 288c26aad11e989520a21276cf187caedd2eeb7b)
'}]
commit_message:
Change runtimes to accept string

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15
(cherry picked from commit 288c26aad11e989520a21276cf187caedd2eeb7b)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I59d376c6da1afc0847a25893d80ca9a210bbe64b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

commit_message:
Change ovs user and fix permissions on ovs upgrade

When upgrading to latest ovs, package needs to run with
ovs user, and also the affected folders need to change their perms.
Change the config file for it, and initially do a perm change. Also
create a one-time service file that will run after reboot, to be
sure that all the remaining folders have changed their perms
properly.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I0e103cb19a7bbaf951d233acfcb51086e57cf264

commit_message:
Add Ironic Networking Baremetal Templates

Ironic neutron agent will be installed on controller nodes, or
networker nodes, when environments/services/ironic.yaml or
environments/services-docker/ironic.yaml is used.

It should also be enabled on undercloud.

Also enables ``baremetal`` ML2 mechanism driver on undercloud.

Depends-On: Ic1f44414e187393d35e1382a42d384760d5757ef
Depends-On: I3c40f84052a41ed440758b971975c5c81ace4225
Change-Id: I0b4ef83a5383ff9726f6d69e0394fc544c381a7e

[{'created': '2018-03-05 10:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Change runtimes to accept string

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15
'}]
commit_message:
Change runtimes to accept string

Currently the runtime is a drop down menu with only
"runc" option. User is not able to enter new runtimes
configured by them. So this patch changes the field to
accept any user input string for runtime.

Change-Id: I5e60dd782b799c013a492f823f144cfbe5fdfc15

commit_message:
Optimizing big 'on-XXX' clauses

* Fixed the implementation of data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context
  method so that it doesn't use copy.deepcopy() because it may be
  very expensive (both CPU and RAM) on big dictionaries.

Change-Id: I6cc77c6ded1e8f00ff164156be9312e1ccb86efb

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I962e48816dad309c2b6d09ab93be1c31d703b00a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add the missing mds and mgr groups into site.yml

Add the ceph-mds and ceph-mgr host group into site.yml,
or the deploy action will be failed when ceph-mds and ceph-mgr is
different from the other ceph groups.

Change-Id: If34483c4a2e8f29b449ced811dd4b42e5b2e7dd4

[{'created': '2018-04-04 23:45:35.000000000', 'message': "Change ha_state property to always return a value

Right now, ha_state could return any value that is in
the state file, or even '' if the file is empty.  Instead,
return the HA_ROUTER_STATE_UNKNOWN value if it isn't valid.

We also need to update the translation map in the HA code
to deal with this new value to avoid a KeyError.

commit_message:
Change ha_state property to always return a value

Right now, ha_state could return any value that is in
the state file, or even '' if the file is empty.  Instead,
return 'unknown' if it's empty.

We also need to update the translation map in the HA code
to deal with this new value to avoid a KeyError.

Related-bug: #1755243

Change-Id: I94a39e574cf4ff5facb76df352c14cbaba793e98

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 21:58:22.000000000', 'message': "Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)
(cherry picked from commit 0d6f9e10749959b0fe88c876319ca03ddac1b34e)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)
(cherry picked from commit 0d6f9e10749959b0fe88c876319ca03ddac1b34e)

[{'created': '2018-03-01 15:27:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use tripleo-upgrade role in undercloud upgrades job.

Featureset047 includes all needed parameters

commit_message:
Use tripleo-upgrade role in undercloud upgrades job.

Featureset047 includes all needed parameters
to run an undercloud upgrade using the
tripleo-upgrade role.

Change toci_gate_test.sh logic to include the
mixed_upgrade environment file *-undercloud-*-overcloud.yml
only when overcloud-deploy is being performed. Otherwise,
it will try to load it for undercloud upgrade too.

Closes-Bug: #1735792
Depends-On: Ib204c89ad88ae4581e556710976325c2b2723039
Change-Id: Iaed38c620f39b66b0b560ae561580dce21ea199b

subject: fix libvirtd service naming and env file for debian

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ia07429ab33d6377160545246519b83746b38b848

commit_message:
Use InvalidConfigurationValue instead of InvalidInput

worker value is from cinder.conf, so use InvalidConfigurationValue
is better.

Change-Id: I51a6d3041b42e9fc97d5562e5ae586000d6db36d

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: If17d72564528bc2e08b3982d5c3dd3fe71b01eec

commit_message:
Add stop_on_exception option for timer threadgroup

Add stop_on_exception option in case of any acceptable exception
occurs in threadgroup.

Change-Id: Ib8c426a0b90f1551899c194dd84e21fa981ce53c

(1 comment)

We should not be circumventing the vif detach function from the network interface, it often performs more actions than just clearing the record of the vif.

I also see no need for us to add a new function for this when we could be iterating over the nodes vifs and then calling the vif detach function.

The current implementation will result in existing out of tree networking interfaces that don't use the common vif port id base being broken until they add this new function, which in most cases is just going to wrap calling vif_detach in a loop anyway."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the vif during teardown because that created created a race
condition, the removal of all vif attachment records only
seems to be the right thing to do since we can't realistically
change nova try harder, and functionally we are otherwise
looking at massive locking changes.

Removing vif records is the lesser evil until we can reach
consensus on completely revamping locking to allow for greater
concurrency.

commit_message:
Remove vifs upon teardown

Since we removed the ability for nova to cleanly remove
the vif during teardown because that created a race condition,
the removal of all vif attachment records only seems to be the
right thing to do since we can't realistically change nova try
harder, and functionally we are otherwise looking at massive
locking changes.

Removing vif records is the lesser evil until we can reach
consensus on completely revamping locking to allow for greater
concurrency.

Change-Id: I8d683d2d506c97535b5a8f9a5de4c070c7e887df
Story: #1743652
Task: #9275

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds in the
requirements files.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Ibeba206f66dc5349de23ece82da101cbd99fa738

commit_message:
remove ec2 in service and cmd

ec2 was deprecated in commit
f098398a836e3671c49bb884b4a1a1988053f4b2
back to mitaka release, this patch
starts to remove ec2 services in nova.

Change-Id: I5939ef73904f1bb66ed8453c900bfb50cdb5b8b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 21:07:18.000000000', 'message': "Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
(cherry picked from commit dd93b0c7190681620c3eed9937462901da42c7c4)
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
(cherry picked from commit dd93b0c7190681620c3eed9937462901da42c7c4)

order so they are easier to find, as some were even
in separate blocks.

Trivialfix

thread starting at

for more details.

commit_message:
Fix wrapping of neutron forbidden error

In neutronv2 api, the neutron forbidden error is not wrapped
correctly. The exception class expects the first parameter as
the error message but an exception object is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1720726
Change-Id: I6e88333427ec2befe2122274b02775f013404e30
(cherry picked from commit f1a0557da4fbd7baa9196cb5c0ccdd7ebb16ecdf)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_timestamp.py

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
(cherry picked from commit 7a714aeb13e99b95a8f495765a1fa57297f92d30)
(cherry picked from commit 71b305cb9e0618000b84e6eef8cc5aa9ecf8848c)

commit_message:
Add warning for nova_catalog_admin_info option

The nova_catalog_admin_info option has been deprecated, but no warning.
So add warning for it.

Change-Id: I5c625a4640542ba109bb7048ede5676837ad487b

commit_message:
Add Octavia v2 tempest plugin jobs to Octavia

This patch adds the tempest API and scenario jobs from
octavia-tempest-plugin to the Octavia gates list.

Initially in non-voting to gauge stability.

Change-Id: Ifca0d1e0e99424d13752694b5e9c4c5731c3ea95

commit_message:
[Scenario] Enable "qos-fip" network extension in tempest config

It is required to run FloatingIP QoS scenario test in test jobs
which uses legacy zuul playbooks (like dvr-multinode job for example)

Change-Id: Id3e94383bc385176e1b19a9c2f64fe29026b59e2

Test commands are now reused between
similar tox targets instead of duplicating them.

Change-Id: I3552a8736c1d71d34efc94ebdcb609b7eb13114d
'}]
commit_message:
tox: cleanup targets

This makes tox code easier to manage and
allows for further refactoring.

Test commands are now reused between
similar tox targets instead of duplicating them.

Change-Id: I3552a8736c1d71d34efc94ebdcb609b7eb13114d

[{'account_id': 25972, 'date': '2017-05-11 14:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-05-11 14:04:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25972, 'date': '2017-05-11 14:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
DRBD: Use the ClientHelper class to reduce amount of code

The DRBD Manage' DrbdManageClientHelp class is designed to accumulate
code that is common across various DRBD Manage clients; using this
shared code eases maintenance.

Depends-On: I4d8bb80f72db6fafc5f37e0e9a32d7ad7d11e87e

Change-Id: Iafb239781ff04b77f88311fa87cfb8edffe3f6e7

RBD incremental backup had a handful of issues that needed to be fixed for the feature to really work.  (Some folks on my team were looking into it a bit ago.)  I'd like to see some analysis showing that this feature actually works, or at least what the remaining steps are, before we land more assorted patches into it.

The first question being: why does this resolve bug 1663504 and not bug 1578036?  What is the remaining gap there?"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2017-11-02 15:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25169, 'date': '2017-11-03 03:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

_rbd_diff_transfer will succeed in the patch, but because 'from_snap' is 'None',  incremental backup will not work, it is doing a full copy every time actually."}, {'account_id': 25169, 'date': '2017-11-03 03:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

All is because of temp volume/snapshot for in-used volume, if we want to support incremental backup for volume in-used, we must resolve it.'}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2017-11-21 21:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer junbo.li with the following votes:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-10 08:54:51.000000000', 'message': "Create incremental backup for volume in-use failed.

If we create backup for volume  in-use, volume
driver will clone a temporary volume, and create
a snapshot based on the temporary volume, then
create backup for the snapshot. So, the src_name
passed to method _rbd_diff_transfer should be the
name of the temporary volume instead of the original
volume's name.

Change-Id: I544c608493a565ce4b42d9e8d23199a44b34668c
Closes-Bug: #1663504

commit_message:
RBD: Create incremental backup for volume in-use failed

If we create backup for volume  in-use, volume
driver will clone a temporary volume, and create
a snapshot based on the temporary volume, then
create backup for the snapshot. So, the src_name
passed to method _rbd_diff_transfer should be the
name of the temporary volume instead of the original
volume's name. In order to get this name, we also need
add self.name to class os_brick.initiator.linuxrbd.RBDVolume.
This patch is accosiates with patch

Co-Authored-By: Hanxi_Liu <hanxi.liu@easystack.cn>
Depends-on: Ic2732e985b75ae710da3814c2d5b2253ced74534
Change-Id: I544c608493a565ce4b42d9e8d23199a44b34668c
Closes-Bug: #1663504

This is not recommended because we may need to relocate the backing during volume attach. The relocate may timeout for large eagerZeroedThick volumes, so it is better to create those backings lazily.'}, {'account_id': 9171, 'date': '2017-12-26 21:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The lazy creation is by design and it works fine for our recommended configuration.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-27 01:38:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The lazy creation is by design and it works fine for our
 > recommended configuration.
Volume cloud be detached and attached to another host, lazy creation still cannot work, because volume actual size become larger, and this error will be raised with anyone of vmware volume types. When vSan or San shared storage is vmware storage, there is none volume movement with volume-attach. The volume type shouldn't be recommended configuration, but the shared storage is recommendation."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-01-04 02:03:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Doesn't seem like this is the right way to go based on Vipin's input."}, {'account_id': 9171, 'date': '2018-01-04 22:30:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@renminmin, I'm not sure whether I fully understood your comment. This is the behavior since Icehouse release. Of course, the performance may be better if we disable lazy creation when there are only shared datastores. Even in this case, disabling it only for eagerZeroedThick doesn't make sense. The best we can do is to disable it completely (if at all the need arises) using a driver config option."}, {'account_id': 24496, 'date': '2018-01-25 09:27:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed. To recheck use 'datacore: recheck'. For information about DataCore CI see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DataCore_CI

commit_message:
Create eagerzeroedthick volume

EagerZeroeThick volume creation need long time.
EagerZeroeThick volume should be created after
volume creation api called.

Change-Id: I300f53a933a598d4f0a3cd3e14c40fc209e786fe
Closes-bug: #1739390

[{'created': '2018-04-12 10:04:41.000000000', 'message': "Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12
(cherry picked from commit 74f70b7a33fe7589cdb28ab44235f83aa5cda158)
"}]
commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12
(cherry picked from commit 74f70b7a33fe7589cdb28ab44235f83aa5cda158)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-23 09:56:59.000000000', 'message': "Create backup without configuring rbd_user.

If ceph cluster does not use any authentication, then we can
configure cinder.conf without option 'rbd_user'. When creating
backup or restoring, if the 'src_user' or 'dest_user' is None,
use 'admin' as default user, or it will report an error.
Closes-Bug: #1658623

Change-Id: Ic9cc4f694048e274ff3d204d349c95cdf7e64176
"}]
commit_message:
Create backup without configuring rbd_user.

If ceph cluster does not use any authentication, then we can
configure cinder.conf without option 'rbd_user'. When creating
backup or restoring, if the 'src_user' or 'dest_user' is None,
use 'admin' as default user, or it will report an error.
Closes-Bug: #1658623

Change-Id: Ic9cc4f694048e274ff3d204d349c95cdf7e64176

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 10:20:18.000000000', 'message': 'ibm_volume_driver: Make ds8k default proxy

The given default is an invalid configuration. It pointed to the common proxy class
which is missing somne parameters in its constructor.

A default should have a sane value. Therfore this patch sets it to the ds8k proxy.

Change-Id: I6c4ca39362d80b71205a9d8f8372e91990e74a0f
'}]
commit_message:
ibm_volume_driver: Make ds8k default proxy

The given default is an invalid configuration. It pointed to the common proxy class
which is missing somne parameters in its constructor.

A default should have a sane value. Therfore this patch sets it to the ds8k proxy.

Change-Id: I6c4ca39362d80b71205a9d8f8372e91990e74a0f
