(7 comments)

This needs some more work. Preliminary:

* volume.manager - receives stuff sent by using volume.rpcapi
* scheduler.manager - receives stuff sent by using scheduler.rpcapi
* …and vice versa
* RPC call returns a value, RPC cast doesn't.

There are a few ways caps are sent over RPC:

1. periodically from c-vol using update_service_capabilities *cast* to scheduler - received in scheduler.manager.update_service_capabilities
2. on demand from c-api using get_capabilities *call* to c-vol.
3. when migrating - from c-vol using get_capabilities *call* to c-vol.

This requires some magic to keep compatibility with Mitaka:

1. Make sure that when sending in scheduler.rpcapi you're sending dict if running with compat to 2.0 (object otherwise). On the other hand be prepared that in scheduler.manager you can receive dict from old c-vols and convert it to object in that case.
2, 3. In volume.manager check ctxt to determine call version. If it's lower than 2.1, return dict. Otherwise return object. In volume.rpcapi make sure that when dict is received you convert it to object.

This should do it. :)"}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2016-05-25 17:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I'll still need to look closely at how you're approaching compatibility problems, but"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2016-06-07 13:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

/Aww, I've accidentally hit enter with my broken hand's cast./

I'll still need to look closely at how you're approaching compatibility problems, but some early feedback after my today's researching:

* There are still more capabilities keys. You can identify most of them by looking at get_volume_stats methods in drivers. Unfortunately some of these are vendor-specific. We can either try to include all of them into the object definition or try to prepare some DictField for them. I think the decision should be based on how much of them are out there.
* Looks like there are drivers not supporting pools. In that case it seems some keys from Pools should be also included in Capabilities. Take a look on BlockDeviceDriver for example.
* There is one serious problem with "extra_capabilities", that are actually a dict blob defined in configuration… Right now these are appended directly into the dictionary. I think we should add them as a new DictField and modify capabilities_filter to make sure the behavior will be consistent.

Yeah… I guess nothing's easy.'}, {'account_id': 20140, 'date': '2016-06-08 05:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@Michal Dulko : I checked and found around 30 new fields used across drivers. Some are keys in pools and others are keys in capabilities. 

Creating a new Dictfield for all new vendor fields might require vendors to handle it in get_volume_stats or update_volume_stats. Not sure if this is the ideal approach. I would rather dump all these fields in pools or capabilities!!

For extra_Capabilities, Yes Good catch. I will work on it.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2016-06-10 10:18:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Okay, let's try to do that explicitly. :)"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2016-06-16 13:43:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

A brief conversation I've had with dansmith:

<dulek> Hi! I wanted to ask about RPC and keeping backward compatibility.
<dansmith> hi
<dulek> Basically we have an RPC call that returns dict and we want to switch that to o.vo.
<dansmith> switch it to return an object you mean?
<dulek> Yup.
<dulek> Do you know if there's a way of telling on the manager side if we were RPC-called with version X or X-1?
<dulek> Because manager needs to know what to return.
<dansmith> you specifically can not know that, no
<dansmith> you have to pass a flag
<dansmith> we used want_objects=False
<dulek> Okay, will do then. I guess such flag is pretty easy to get rid of with a major RPC version bump.
<dulek> Thanks!
<dansmith> yep

Looks like we'll need to implement it with that flag. Sorry for confusing you earlier - I haven't thought it up fully."}, {'account_id': 20140, 'date': '2016-06-16 21:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-16 22:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

Comment 'run-netapp-ci' or 'netapp-ci-recheck' to rerun these tests. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/NetApp_CI"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2016-10-04 19:57:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 44: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Few fundamental comments inline, I'll need to figure out the object layer itself later, but I like the extra_capabilities approach to vendor stuff in there, so something like this should be way to go.

I think there can be one more backward compatibility problem in this patch. Capabilities are returned from `get_capabilities` RPC call to c-vol. Now this call is used by c-vol itself in migrate flow [1]. The problem with such c-vol<->c-vol communication is is that receiving c-vol is unable to tell on the manager's side if it was called by newer or older c-vol service during the upgrade. This is a similar situation like in patch [2], note how it uses want_objects argument of get_backup_device in volume.manager and volume.rpcapi. It may be worth to clean it up in another patch and in this one make get_capabilities always return a dict.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/dc74d836cbd1f81be1f1e8242ed2623c049bf1dd/cinder/volume/manager.py#L1680-L1681
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329332/"}, {'account_id': 20140, 'date': '2016-10-05 05:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 45.'}, {'account_id': 20140, 'date': '2016-10-05 05:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44:

convert it from dict blob to Oslo Versioned object notation. This is important
so that capabilities are supporting backporting in case of rolling-upgrades

commit_message:
Switch service capabilities to ovo

The c-vol currently sends service capabilities to c-sch in dict form.
We need convert it from dict blob to Oslo Versioned object notation.
This is important so that capabilities are supporting backporting in
case of rolling-upgrades

Change-Id: I1586c2b2b20c92724ca931d9aeb6b60c8d19ef97
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects
Depends-On: Iab6156cc25f78e8f80b220bc93c2b2e4974a585a
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wróblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-22 16:43:00.000000000', 'message': "Refactoring total_capacity_gb & free_capavity_gb in capabilities

Currently some drivers can report total_capacity_gb &
free_capacity_gb in service capabilities with values 'infinite' &
'unknown'. Since these fields are mostly having float values, it
creates problems when we are trying to structure service capabilities
as ovo.

This change mandates all drivers to use values of 'inf' & 'NaN'
instead of 'infinite' & 'unknown' respectively. 'inf' and 'NaN'
can be type casted to float but 'infinite & 'unknown' cannot

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3681415654c25f8a6c4dec838a62831f7ae35b13

commit_message:
Refactoring total_capacity_gb & free_capacity_gb in capabilities

Currently some drivers can report total_capacity_gb &
free_capacity_gb in service capabilities with values 'infinite' &
'unknown'. Since these fields are mostly having float values, it
creates problems when we are trying to structure service capabilities
as ovo.

This change mandates all drivers to use values of 'inf' & 'NaN'
instead of 'infinite' & 'unknown' respectively. 'inf' and 'NaN'
can be type casted to float but 'infinite & 'unknown' cannot

Closes-bug: #1629143
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3681415654c25f8a6c4dec838a62831f7ae35b13

commit_message:
sphinxext: Use 'sphinx.util.logging'

This resolves a deprecation warning. It also allows us to stop passing
around the 'app' variable just to enable logging.

Change-Id: I7b7e29ae6dec086373bbaeb2ebaae5ed7e9628b1

commit_message:
Change testenv from py34 to py35

- The Zuul gate currently only support py35.
- In setup.cfg, the project said that it support
Programming Language :: Python :: 3.5.

Therefor, this patch changes py34 to py35.

Change-Id: Iaad9bf41e3c8a8915c06ff039e570a2cc41ca2a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 16:53:04.000000000', 'message': 'eventletutils: Fix behavior discrepency when reusing Events

The threading.Event object allows calling set() multiple times, but
the eventlet.Event object only permits send() to be called once,
before a reset() is required to reuse the Event.

Calling eventletutils.Event.set() multiple times triggers an
AssertionError from eventlet.Event.  This change resets the underlying
eventlet.Event if the set() method had already been called previously,
and ensures the eventletutils.Event behaves the same as the
threading.Event.

Change-Id: If761b237266bbfe7e65c56e152074b5d1ccac74b
'}, {'created': '2018-04-11 17:02:41.000000000', 'message': 'eventletutils: Fix behavior discrepency when reusing Events

The threading.Event object allows calling set() multiple times, but
the eventlet.Event object only permits send() to be called once,
before a reset() is required to reuse the Event.

Calling eventletutils.Event.set() multiple times triggers an
AssertionError from eventlet.Event.  This change resets the underlying
eventlet.Event if the set() method had already been called previously,
and ensures the eventletutils.Event behaves the same as the
threading.Event.

Change-Id: If761b237266bbfe7e65c56e152074b5d1ccac74b
'}]
commit_message:
eventletutils: Fix behavior discrepency when reusing Events

The threading.Event object allows calling set() multiple times, but
the eventlet.Event object only permits send() to be called once,
before a reset() is required to reuse the Event.

Calling eventletutils.Event.set() multiple times triggers an
AssertionError from eventlet.Event.  This change resets the underlying
eventlet.Event if the set() method had already been called previously,
and ensures the eventletutils.Event behaves the same as the
threading.Event.

Change-Id: If761b237266bbfe7e65c56e152074b5d1ccac74b

commit_message:
Enforce env_variables values to string before run

Converts extra_env_variables values to string because processutils
expect them to be so.

Change-Id: If033001d53f9163ef998fcd162dff1b76fb586d7
Closes-Bug: #1761232
(cherry picked from commit 242b6714e6fad9111440b5413bcbc66427c4bc72)

commit_message:
Update gabbi to 1.42.0 for sake of heat

The heat tempest plugin has a situation where it is important to
be able to list tests when the target host is unknown. This was
impossible with gabbi<1.42.0, so this updates the upper contraint
to 1.42.0, which provides the required functionality.

Change-Id: Ie0dce3570e1459b68571ce3e5a404299786b1359
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561709/

[{'created': '2018-04-17 13:56:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant _do_check_can_live_migrate_destination

This was added in change I8c2f1a67 with the note:

===
We'll want to add claims around the logic of this method, so it's better
if there is a nested method that does the business logic to
avoid deep nesting that makes the code less readable.

AFAICT this logic was never added, and the indirection has always been

Change-Id: Ie01f2c056a85e08a46c2461f1952cfdbaac3a547

commit_message:
Remove redundant _do_check_can_live_migrate_destination

This was added in change I8c2f1a67 with the note:

===
We'll want to add claims around the logic of this method, so it's better
if there is a nested method that does the business logic to
avoid deep nesting that makes the code less readable.
===

AFAICT this logic was never added, and the indirection has always been
redundant.

Change-Id: Ie01f2c056a85e08a46c2461f1952cfdbaac3a547

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iada24c34d3d5c6ef75ed59d3567f970119308640
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use https for stackviz get

We are noticing on nb03 that the curl get of this file fails; but it
starts working when you use https.  Switch to it.

Change-Id: I5fef4281547758f484cd8a93326b0cfeb790762a

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 2

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-resize-start
* instance-resize-end
* instance-resize-error
* instance-resize_finish-start
* instance-resize_finish-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I4b3728a18d604f07ebffe45eec457e47bba98b7e

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia57e373aed0982340ca7f2f37801f5218a0c394e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 18:51:13.000000000', 'message': "Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Correct permissions on the nova logfiles

When you execute nova-manage commands, oslo logs to the following
location (file name is dynamically created based on command name).

    /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log

Because puppet-nova is executing these commands as root,
nova-manage.log is owned by root, preventing the 'nova-manage
db archive_deleted_rows' entry in nova's crontab from executing.

    Permission denied: '/var/log/nova/nova-manage.log'

This log file is also an outlier, as all other log files in
/var/log/nova/ are owned by nova:nova.

Similar issues are possible for other nova logs, if for example
a nova services is initially started manually as root, so the
ownership of all nova logs is corrected before configuring nova.

Co-Authored-By: Oliver Walsh <owalsh@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>
Closes-Bug: #1671681
Change-Id: I0ca0110cbf9139c79074cf603dcab9135f96e765
(cherry picked from commit e128ba6538eb806589ebc01c16ee5e298bb0ee86)

commit_message:
Switch to ubuntu-minimal for default amphora image

Previously we were using the "ubuntu" diskimage-builder base element as the
default base OS to build the amphora image.
The "ubuntu" element is based on the ubuntu cloud image. This image includes
packages we do not need for the amphora image. At this point it's not clear
that Ubuntu will ship an 18.04 LTS cloud image in the format the "ubuntu"
element requires.
This patch switches the default Ubuntu amphora image to build with the
"ubuntu-minimal" diskimage-builder element.

This patch also moves the amphora agent into a virtual environment inside
the amphora.

It also sets up support for Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic beaver) and HAProxy 1.8.

Change-Id: I84a85ca1363bce2e0f13da64540ec7ba3575e818

[{'created': '2018-02-12 18:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Block swap_volume attempts with encrypted volumes

This change uses parts of Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022 &
Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355 in order to block attempts to
swap_volume with encrypted volumes prior to Queens where a complete fix
landed as part of the native LUKS blueprint.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 10:08:14.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Block swap volume attempts with encrypted volumes

Prior to Queens any attempt to swap between encrypted volumes would
result in unencrypted data being written to the new volume. This
unencrypted data would then be overwritten the next time the volume was
reattached to an instance as the host no longer identifies it as
encrypted, resulting in the volume being reformatted by n-cpu.

This stable branch only change uses limited parts of the following
changes to block swap_volume with encrypted volumes prior to Queens.

Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

The request context is provided to swap_volume in order to look up the
encryption metadata of a volume.

Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

Attempts to swap encrypted volumes are blocked with NotImplementedError raised.

Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb

The serial of a volume is used as the id if connection_info for the
volume doesn't contain the volume_id key. Required to avoid bug #1746609.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8

commit_message:
libvirt: Block swap volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens

Prior to Queens any attempt to swap between encrypted volumes would
result in unencrypted data being written to the new volume. This
unencrypted data would then be overwritten the next time the volume was
attached to an instance as Nova no longer identified the volume as
encrypted, resulting in the volume being reformatted.

This stable only change uses limited parts of the following changes to
block all swap_volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens
where this was resolved by Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18 and also
blocked when using QEMU to decrypt LUKS volumes by
Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1.

Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

The request context is provided to swap_volume in order to look up the
encryption metadata of a volume.

Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

Attempts to swap from an encrypted volume are blocked with a
NotImplementedError exception raised.

I258127fdcd011ccec721d5ff62eb7f128f130336

Attempts to swap from an unencrypted volume to an encrypted volume are
also blocked with a NotImplementedError exception raised.

Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb

The serial of a volume is used as the id if connection_info for the
volume doesn't contain the volume_id key. Required to avoid bug #1746609.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8

commit_message:
Move LIBS_FROM_GIT check to apply more broadly

All current known uses of LIBS_FROM_GIT installations use setup_develop,
but in case other situations arise in the future, move the check
to _setup_package_with_constraints_edit which is used by several other
installation methods.

Change-Id: Ifb21fd7d666e219299d65be97a13fb8300a64169

commit_message:
Correct the string formatting in a info log message

It should be "%s," not just "%,". The error observed was something
like...

ValueError: unsupported format character ',' (0x2c) at index 91

Closes-Bug: #1764696
Change-Id: I601c8640cec857746c2c17f94116da890f4d65e0

commit_message:
Update prepare using an environment file

We'll be using t-h-t environment files to insert and remove no-ops in
the plan/stack. This should help make the update/upgrade Mistral
workflows more release-agnostic and thus reduce the risk of bugs in
mixed-release UC/OC enviornments.

Depends-On: I486ad0d44f105a6fa9fd24dcf7ac28d40ceecc27
Change-Id: If173d5f6e0be71f467bd062627e9f17e8b684b99
(cherry picked from commit d5c58c246564f05dd7c9fc189bf8f87e05442140)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 16:31:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix gate issues

NOTE(mriedem/smatzek): This is a squash of two commits.

The first commit message is:

Jobs run as jenkins on Zuul v2 but run as user zuul on Zuul v3.

NOTE(mriedem): This is only taking one specific fix from the large
change on master (queens) since we don't need the other changes
for stable/pike to fix the gate.

(cherry picked from commit 9ec134996a1162de0d74ef915dc138bbacbcfdf1)

This is the 2nd commit message:

Increase the TROVE_AGENT_CALL_HIGH_TIMEOUT to
help the upgrade test pass. The upgrade test has an agent call
that takes longer than the current timeout when running in
the gate on Nova compute with virt_type set as qemu.

NOTE(smatzek): This is only taking one fix from this change as
the other is N/A in this case as it was enabling the disabled
integration tests.

(cherry picked from commit d7b773d2b07f0c95909ef73c4644a63f09fd82c3)

Change-Id: Ic55187b0d73d4c572d7f8332882b4f455a6177c8
(cherry picked from commit e6d4b4b3fe1768348c9df815940b97cecb5e7ee2)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate issues

NOTE(mriedem/smatzek): This is a squash of two commits.

The first commit message is:

Jobs run as jenkins on Zuul v2 but run as user zuul on Zuul v3.

NOTE(mriedem): This is only taking one specific fix from the large
change on master (queens) since we don't need the other changes
for stable/pike to fix the gate.

(cherry picked from commit 9ec134996a1162de0d74ef915dc138bbacbcfdf1)

This is the 2nd commit message:

Increase the TROVE_AGENT_CALL_HIGH_TIMEOUT to
help the upgrade test pass. The upgrade test has an agent call
that takes longer than the current timeout when running in
the gate on Nova compute with virt_type set as qemu.

NOTE(smatzek): This is only taking one fix from this change as
the other is N/A in this case as it was enabling the disabled
integration tests.

(cherry picked from commit d7b773d2b07f0c95909ef73c4644a63f09fd82c3)

Change-Id: Ic55187b0d73d4c572d7f8332882b4f455a6177c8
(cherry picked from commit e6d4b4b3fe1768348c9df815940b97cecb5e7ee2)

commit_message:
Fix mysql instance create failed when enable skip-name-resolve

In the guestagent code, it create os_admin user only grant
privileges on host:localhost, but use host:127.0.0.1 to
connect to mysql. Modify host privileges grant on to 127.0.0.1
to avoid create instance failed when enable skip-name-resolve
in config file.

Change-Id: Ifa69461c8a55464f88aec001d067450eedccf172
Closes-bug: #1729225
(cherry picked from commit 43c545ac84f29908a2e5396d07bd3de38e3a1101)

The devstack plugin sets a 3 hour Keystone token life
but Keystone is already running when this configuration change
is called so Keystone still runs with the default for the tests.

Change-Id: Ie340b1c0b56652fc9ca4c0981468363c1be9fb25

commit_message:
Enable longer Keystone token life

The devstack plugin sets a 3 hour Keystone token life
but Keystone is already running when this configuration change
is called so Keystone still runs with the default for the tests.

Add a restart of Keystone to enable the longer life.

Change-Id: Ie340b1c0b56652fc9ca4c0981468363c1be9fb25
(cherry picked from commit a3514d84208d0244bb3a8aa3fc76092349c40115)

commit_message:
Open the volume_support of redis

In the past, we support volume_support when we support
redis-cluster[1], but we did not update to conf[2].
we are making the sample conf files match the
default configuration in code.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203702/
[2]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107117/

Closes-Bug: #1701469
Change-Id: I428e274fdb85621b21453780e90a8a0ab401ffd9
(cherry picked from commit 5b7930446f5d1ea0bd663aeb9070f35925dced50)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 06:53:01.000000000', 'message': 'Microversion 2.61 - support extra_specs in flavor API

The following changes are applied starting from microversion 2.61.

* The ``extra_specs`` in the response is shown by default and
  the ``--extra-specs`` option has been removed
  at the ``nova flavor-list`` command.

* The ``extra_specs`` in the response is shown
  at the ``nova flavor-update`` command.

* The ``extra_specs`` of the flavor is shown
  at the ``nova flavor-delete`` command.

* The API calls to acquire each extra specs (os-extra_specs)
  is not called at the ``nova flavor-show`` and
  ``nova flavor-list`` command.

Change-Id: I10d621d9b62764114d55cb368e720d182eaffd11
Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list
'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 01:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Microversion 2.61 - support extra_specs in flavor API

Starting from microversion 2.61, the responses of the 'Flavor' APIs
include the 'extra_spec' parameter. Therefore 'Flavors extra-specs'
(os-extra_specs) API calls have been removed in the following commands
since microversion 2.61.

* nova flavor-list

commit_message:
Microversion 2.61 - support extra_specs in flavor API

Starting from microversion 2.61, the responses of the 'Flavor' APIs
include the 'extra_specs' parameter. Therefore 'Flavors extra-specs'
(os-extra_specs) API calls have been removed in the following commands
since microversion 2.61.

* nova flavor-list
* nova flavor-show

Change-Id: I10d621d9b62764114d55cb368e720d182eaffd11
Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Fixes/Updates OSH Developer and Multinode install guide

This PS fixes few typos and adds DNS entry update section
to notify user.

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_serversV21.py (1)

Replace stubs.Set for the following methods with mock in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py.

* nova.compute.api.API.get
* nova.compute.api.API.get_all

Subsequent patches will replace stubs.Set in test cases.

Change-Id: Ib0f55b40357cc714a9be9add76b0dc94169f1afc
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

Rodrigo confirmed on irc that there is a workaround being worked on.. It'd be nice to preserve the release note and reference the original bug fix in that workaround. 

ganso tbarron, gouthamr, bswartz, xyang: Hi! Could you please take a look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561975 ? We are reverting a patch that broke NetApp driver
[11:38:20] gouthamr ganso: makes sense to revert, but are you shooting to make a patch for ocata and newton?
[11:38:30] ganso gouthamr: yes
[11:38:41] ganso gouthamr: patch is ready downstream, just waiting for the revert to land
[11:38:51] gouthamr https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561975/2/manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py@645 -> seems like all you need to check is if the share size on ONTAP is different from the share instance's size in manila
[11:38:58] gouthamr ah good stuff ganso 
[11:39:12] ganso gouthamr: that's what I've implemented as a backport workaround
[11:39:38] gouthamr ganso: nice, thanks
[11:39:41] ganso gouthamr: it is one additional call to the backend, but necessary one since we don't have the size field
[11:39:54] gouthamr ganso: yeah, i think that was my initial approach
[11:40:24] gouthamr now dissecting the alembic migrations, i realized this size field was slipped into a share group snapshots feature"}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2018-04-17 19:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

commit_message:
Revert "NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot"

This reverts commit 1183b19f1c6e6e3fd15d35ebc845317165f4bf82.

This patch breaks the NetApp ONTAP driver when creating
shares from snapshots because there was no 'size' attribute
in ShareSnapshotInstance DB model back in Ocata.

Change-Id: I660925b1d3cad7407b5990dff3fb3dc926270c7c

commit_message:
Activate another set of healthchecks

In previous patches link to appropriate scripts were not added.
This patch adds links related to following already merged patches:
 - I757d53189f5819bb3a0e7bebe277353f3460738d
 - I4a193d7ce1c455da2865498470ed3b98160df112
 - Ie8eaab9919bde61793a3310328ee9f117c4e58da
 - Ief543580e6b717bb9dba62b19ffe12aff5395ff9

This patch also adds exec permission to some of the healthchecks
added in above patches.

Change-Id: Id5dc7d169301e45cb0abab7cecae67457db9fd96

add some return value to the get mock? maybe thats what causes test failure'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-12-13 03:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-12-13 03:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2017-12-13 03:52:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> add some return value to the get mock? maybe thats what causes test
 > failure

Thanks for reminder, and I got this case pass in my local test env, But I don't know why get back failure in CI, :(

Anyway, you're right, I have addressed your comment, because we really don't need a real sleep in the test world."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-16 20:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Overall this looks like a good change to me.

Since the max_retry_interval defaults to 10, in most cases this is going to become a random retry of between 0 and 10 seconds after only a couple of retries.  Because of that, I'm okay with keeping the 0..n behavior.  According to the blog post that has comparable benefits to the partial jitter and it results in faster completion of all clients.

I do wonder if we could make the backoff a callable and allow users to define their own backoff function.  I'm not sure if there's enough need for that to introduce the extra complexity though.  I thought I'd mention it in any case.

I have a couple of specific comments inline too that I think should be addressed."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

lets see if the backoff can be localized to just deadlock and then I'll try to find some time to think more about jitter.   I hardly understood my previous comment three months later :)"}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-29 10:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-29 11:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

@Ben @zzzeek

Thanks for review, and sorry for my late reply and update.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-29 11:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-06 17:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I just noticed that this is a decorator, but based on some testing I think my comments are still valid.  The decorator object is only initialized once so subsequent calls will have the same values for member variables.  More details inline.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-09 04:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-09 04:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

@bnemec, Thanks for your detail advice and I updated the patch. : )'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Sorry I didn't catch this sooner, but I think we're using the wrong terminology here.  Exponential backoff is always used for these retries, what we're actually adding here is jitter.  This means the current name of the parameter is misleading.  I think we need to rename the "exp_backoff" param to "jitter".

I also noticed a potential issue inline that I think we need to address.

_Hopefully_ I didn't miss anything this time and once those problems are fixed we can get this merged.  Thanks for your patience with it.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Gooood catch, but I still have some other consideration on here, If you agree with me, I will draft my idea in next patch.

Thanks your patient review, even I want to merge it ASSP (LOL, from every committer mind), but I enjoy the discussion with you, and we need more dicussion before we merge it, especially in the oslo project which has influence lots of project! So, It's worth it. :)"}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-11 17:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Yeah, this should provide a more consistent backoff range, which better reflects the intent of the exponential backoff.  Definite +1 to this implementation.

One nit on the unit tests inline, but otherwise this looks good to me now.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Thanks for your help! :)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Great, thanks!  This looks ready to go to me then.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-04-12 15:25:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

I've got optional nits in here"}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

@zzzeek, Thanks, I will update in next PS.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Great, thanks!  This looks ready to go to me then.

Thanks! :)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:39:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-17 17:36:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Looks fine, thanks Yikun.

In the future, it's probably worth replacing all the custom retry code with the tenacity library (Julien's fork of the retrying library).

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-04-17 17:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-12 10:25:47.000000000', 'message': 'Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

The @oslo_db.api.wrap_db_retry is used for db.api methods
retrying. If db_error raised, the decorator help us to call
the api methods again after a few seconds(accurately, is
2**retry_times seconds).

If the db_error is deadlock error, the old wrap_db_retry
is not so suitable anymore. As we know, some deadlocks cause
because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If
we only retry after stable 2**retry_times seconds, we will
recall the method concurrently again.

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock
and reduce the average sleep time, we propose to add some
random jitter to the delay period by default when the
deadlock error is detected.

Change-Id: I206745708570f1f292529ff58eee9b83fc09a9f2
Closes-bug: to be add
'}, {'created': '2017-12-13 03:48:19.000000000', 'message': 'Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

commit_message:
Improve exponential backoff for wrap_db_retry

The @oslo_db.api.wrap_db_retry is used for db.api methods
retrying. If db_error raised, the decorator help us to call
the api methods again after a few seconds(accurately, is
2**retry_times seconds).

If the db_error is deadlock error, the old wrap_db_retry
is not so suitable anymore. As we know, some deadlocks cause
because we call some methods(transactions) concurrently. If
we only retry after stable 2**retry_times seconds, we will
recall the method concurrently again.

In order to minimize the chance of regenerating a deadlock
and reduce the average sleep time, we propose to add some
random jitter to the delay period by default when the
deadlock error is detected.

Change-Id: I206745708570f1f292529ff58eee9b83fc09a9f2
Closes-bug: #1737869

commit_message:
Extend config-grabbing magic to new oslo.config

Some changes (in what are admittedly private methods) from oslo.config
5.x to 6.x broke our hacky bits. These bits have now been adjusted to
be compatible with a wider range of oslo.config versions.

This delicate code must be maintained in order to support grabbing
config values from [keystone_authtoken], a behavior which is usually
discouraged.

Change-Id: I9aaa4a3e9052a61269bb7ffcc642383ad6c5a0d8
Story: 2001835
Task: 12598

commit_message:
Extend linters time out

Linters are extended to 15 minutes. A few jobs have been just
reaching the 10 minute deadline, so using 15 minutes should
leave plenty of wiggle room.

Change-Id: I1473d55498d72f5611ae09e0d2e7b709954bb363

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.12

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I593766652cc6131e2d74ed74b36fc7337caa228a
Change-Id: Id36e58bca9e6869424f329f1f0d2872c64dadfc1

commit_message:
doc: BFV instances and IsolatedHostsFilter

Since BFV instances don't have a specific image attached to them, the
filter will consider them as not having a specific image, hence not
isolated. Correcting the doc.

Change-Id: Ib235fca1365ee7a38b94600960ee3947f448c4a9

[{'created': '2018-04-17 08:23:29.000000000', 'message': "Use 'timestamp' name consistently in ShardRange

The attr name is 'timestamp' but 'created_at' was used in the
constructor and serialized form. 'timestamp' is now used consistently,
since the time value is not specific to a creation event.

Change-Id: I116cd493a64bb296047bdc832ecbcf2d478bcdcc
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'timestamp' name consistently in ShardRange

The attr name is 'timestamp' but 'created_at' was used in the
constructor and serialized form. 'timestamp' is now used consistently,
since the time value is not specific to a creation event.

Change-Id: I116cd493a64bb296047bdc832ecbcf2d478bcdcc

commit_message:
Re-order database migrations

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the
sequence of tasks. This also now happens to be necessary due
to changes in the Rocky API database.

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771
Related-Bug: #1761775

commit_message:
Add APM Server

The elastic Stack has the ability to get application performance metrics
using the built in APM server. This change implements the APM server in
an existing ELK environment.

Change-Id: Ie6f533b81cfdb0c6a4ba2f33fd3b9f0a3e49a1fc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.3

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Iad4572f75808c63c0d3fa1ec6bb5307fc51a074a
Change-Id: I6a79da037fcf7771868b034bb933c4e3758c7983

commit_message:
Add CREATE_FAILED as a failure state in magnum cluster tests

When the creation of a cluster fails with CREATE_FAILED it waits until
it hits the timeout and it should fail immediately

Change-Id: Ib0f5651720a15c7a276af71a58fbc6f289cb593b

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I913e56c676890c4071f60aa190d02bfaca264d76
(cherry picked from commit 1051fbe10b443801c96a4efaff7acc8697e3fa5d)

[{'created': '2018-04-13 12:20:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the

commit_message:
Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

The idea is to stop doing it in the tripleo-common like [1][2]
and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the
same and include the expected environment file.

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py#L62-L76
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/plan.py#L492-L502
Depends-On: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
Change-Id: I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2
(cherry picked from commit a31c22bd57c324f7327e387a54bc05a23277c631)

[{'created': '2018-04-10 09:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Force ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST to empty list for collect_nodes_uuid

The collect_nodes_uuid parses ansible json output which might contain
spurious lines if additional output callbacks are enabled. This change
explicitly sets the callback whitelist to empty string before
lauching ansible-playbook to ensure only the json plugin is loaded.

Change-Id: Ic133f99988fcc4f6e20ef327b6f2e753c3fff394
Closes-Bug: 1755539
(cherry picked from commit f2cef740910c5c449596b9f59d7bdfa2f126d0c2)
'}]
commit_message:
Force ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST to empty list for collect_nodes_uuid

The collect_nodes_uuid parses ansible json output which might contain
spurious lines if additional output callbacks are enabled. This change
explicitly sets the callback whitelist to empty string before
lauching ansible-playbook to ensure only the json plugin is loaded.

Change-Id: Ic133f99988fcc4f6e20ef327b6f2e753c3fff394
Closes-Bug: 1755539
(cherry picked from commit f2cef740910c5c449596b9f59d7bdfa2f126d0c2)

[{'created': '2018-04-11 00:34:46.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve pep8 E402 errors and no longer ignore E402

Fix the pep8 E402 (Module level import not at top of file) errors.

For the Alembic files move the definitions of 'revision' and
'down_revision' below the imports. This is now done in Alembic [1]

For other files fix as needed by moving the imports or lines before
the imports.

In a few cases add a "# noqa E402" to whitelist the issue.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/commits/dc2aae0374b76ccab8494be6e103d84089bc449b

Change-Id: I48c96d5da0cb747b3ca3fceea9b4ffa85a9ebe22
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve pep8 E402 errors and no longer ignore E402

Fix the pep8 E402 (Module level import not at top of file) errors.

For the Alembic files move the definitions of 'revision' and
'down_revision' below the imports. This is now done in Alembic [1]

For other files fix as needed by moving the imports or lines before
the imports.

In a few cases add a "# noqa E402" to whitelist the issue.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/commits/dc2aae0374b76ccab8494be6e103d84089bc449b

Change-Id: I48c96d5da0cb747b3ca3fceea9b4ffa85a9ebe22

commit_message:
Set sample_default for 'host' option

This prevents build system hostnames from being
written into sample conf files.

Change-Id: I8c52db1e375116c750da9a619aaaea134bddebbe

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

About PrettyTable requirement:
The minimum version of PrettyTable is not correct in requirements.txt,
which should be 0.7.2 according to the unittests(before 0.7.2, if the
table is empty, i.e. no rows in the table, PrettyTable won't print the
headers and borders, this is changed during 0.7.2)

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia9cadcbc2bc9aa2864fe47040dfe7be8ae286b98
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

this looks fine,
Going to bug

    tripleo_ci: false

Set to true when running the role in the TripleO CI jobs. It avoids losing connectivity to the undercloud by skipping reboot and ssh kill tasks.

IMHO.. variables should  reboot|bool and ssh_kill|bool'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-17 02:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-17 11:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-04-17 13:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add tripleo-upgrade vars into featureset050.

Variables use_oooq and tripleo_ci are needed
to be set if we want to use the tripleo-upgrade
role in upstream CI.

Change-Id: Ic0d30148bbadee03ce012a15d31a80b557bd32f8

commit_message:
[ci] Add docker-check job

Add a new job to check that it is possible to build docker image for the
recent version of rally-openstack

Change-Id: Icbd8224c5cd0afebeb5e8e178b9ae216665607ce

commit_message:
cors: update default configuration

Set_defaults has been added into oslo_middleware. So we use it to
override the configuration defaults.

Change-Id: I429bb227f4e5398c95abd594eb6a420e544a5cba

From inspection this looks sane, but ...

I tried this out today using this command with a fresh .quickstart that has this patch cherry-picked on top:

./quickstart.sh -w .quickstart -R tripleo-ci/master -T all -S tripleoui-validate -c .quickstart/config/general_config/featureset049.yml -N .quickstart/config/nodes/3ctlr_2comp_3ceph.yml 127.0.0.2 -n 



and got the following undercloud deploy failure at setup of undercloud sshd service -- haven't had a chance to investigate yet:

commit_message:
Add a new nodes configuration and featureset049 for Ceph

The new featureset aims at deploying Ceph in containers, use
network isolation on a single nic and Pacemaker.

Change-Id: Iaff336bc8416e724af79357eff0fbedce0aba374

commit_message:
Correct stack and add ceph_ansible_playbook in upgrade unittests.

The stack name being mocked was not matching
with the one used in the args. This didn't fail
because at the time of asserting mock_upgrade
we were passing still the wrong stack name, not
the one from the arguments.

This patch also adds the ceph_ansible_playbook
arg to verifylist.

Change-Id: I854ce652995c3381c389d5f4d7e6b68d881f78bb

commit_message:
Miscellaneous iSCSI improvements

This commit has changes for below 3 items.

1) It adds _get_iscsi_conn_props to process connection_info data for
   iSCSI properties.
2) It removes the target_name when creating scsi mapping because that's
   now being handled correctly at the platform level.
3) It adds more testing around 'CHAP' auth_method.

Change-Id: Ib6deef7b15bdb73a23f5edb5ec3fb6cbc9fe4e93

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I19923d160901a96ee175192d23d09ad9800bcc57
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I60514447afcc2423821da4b5762f55056177874f

fails.

[{'account_id': 27888, 'date': '2018-02-27 19:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-27 19:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 19:26:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix help for subcommands on interactive shell

Using the latest cliff (2.11.0), I hit the
following bug running help on subcommands:

(myapp) help mysubcommand
... stack trace omitted for brevity ...
EXCEPTION of type 'AttributeError' occurred with message: ''InteractiveApp' object has no attribute 'parsed''

It does seem like cmd2.Cmd changed its interface
and now we don't have the .parse method anymore.
Let's handle both new and old interfaces.

Change-Id: I407be7f5ed2b6bbe10d5b817aae7598414bbbaa7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Meneghel Rodrigues <lookkas@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix help for subcommands on interactive shell

Using the latest cliff (2.11.0), I hit the
following bug running help on subcommands:

(myapp) help mysubcommand
... stack trace omitted for brevity ...
EXCEPTION of type 'AttributeError' occurred with message: ''InteractiveApp' object has no attribute 'parsed''

It does seem like cmd2.Cmd changed its interface
and now we don't have the .parse method anymore.
Let's handle both new and old interfaces.

Change-Id: I407be7f5ed2b6bbe10d5b817aae7598414bbbaa7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Meneghel Rodrigues <lookkas@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Deduplicate notification samples Rocky - 1

This patch refactors the sample files of:

* instance-rebuild-start
* instance-rebuild-end
* instance-rebuild-error
* instance-restore-start
* instance-resotre-end
* instance-resume-start
* instance-resume-end

notifications to use a common InstanceActionPayload sample data.

Change-Id: I459c39a5dcb928ec3bb03fe144afa0f1ea82f95b

commit_message:
Functional test for regression bug #1713783

Add functional test for evacuation, when no valid host available.
Migration should end up in 'error' state.

Original patch is modified as in Ocata os-service API still uses
the old way of identifing services.

Also, due to bugfix of #1744325 the state of the server after a
failed evacuation is no longer ACTIVE rather ERROR.

Change-Id: I1adc20f2a5261e6906a18b9aee5cd2c8ecf0cf4d
Related-bug: #1713783
(cherry picked from commit 5687c170ea003aafa2720fb00af9d84836bb41df)
(cherry picked from commit e87d9f51abea0b1c97628ef02435157da4b334ec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 12:21:07.000000000', 'message': "ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)

As written I don't think this can work for what the current POST /allocations allows (and should allow, I think). See comment within in response to your TODO."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-09 19:27:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

so I do understand your difficulties with this so far, Ed. and most of those difficulties lie in the fact that the consumer/project/user stuff was tacked on to the placement modeling in a willy-nilly way, including all the ensure_project() ensure_user() things and the fact that there was no Consumer object added when we created the new consumers table to consolidate information about projects and users...

Anyways... my suggestion would be to break this up. Do an initial patch that adds the Consumer object and then a following patch that teases out all the ensure_project() ensure_user() stuff into appropriately decoupled pieces (possibly as member methods on the Consumer object, but I'll leave that to you to play with). And then finally, get back to the meat of this patch which adds the generation handling....

Thoughts?

(1 comment)

I'm sorry, Ed, I'm not liking this latest revision. There's too much coupling of the creation of consumer records with the incrementing of the consumer generation.

I would prefer to see a couple patches before this one that lay the groundwork for incrementing consumer generations, namely, ones that implement the following cleanups:

1) Create a Consumer object like you had on a previous revision.

2) Move the AllocationList._ensure_consumer_project_user() code out of that method and "ensure" consumer records are properly created in the handler for set_allocations().

3) Change the Allocation object to have a 'consumer' field of type ObjectField('Consumer'). Pass a constructed Consumer object to the Allocation constructors in the _new_allocations() function in the allocations.py handler.

4) Then add consumer generation incrementing after all the above patches land.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-04-17 16:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add handlers for consumer_generation

The previous patch added the 'generation' field to the consumers table.
This patch adds the code to increase the generation whenever allocations
are changed for a consumer.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Ie7b28216a53ceddb643fdaff9d69840d87114cba

Do not log passwords
